changes.value: Hazards
A creature, Droid, or object takes Fire damage.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the flames are extinguished. A creature can put out the flames as a Full-Round Action.

system.description:
See also: Hazards

A creature or character that takes Fire damage also catches on Fire. When clothing or objects catch Fire, they continue to burn and take Fire damage.

Fire Statistics (CL 3)

Keywords: Artificial or Natural, Fire

Trigger: A creature, Droid, or object takes Fire damage.

Attack: +5 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the flames are extinguished. A creature can put out the flames as a Full-Round Action.

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship begins its turn within an Asteroid Field.
Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Asteroid Field.

Perception (DC 19): The character notices asteroids heading toward the Starship. Pilot (DC 28): The character tries to avoid hitting any asteroids for 1 round, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to the Starship's Reflex Defense to avoid the incoming rocks.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

"The possibility of successfully navigating an asteroid field is approximately 3,720 to 7." -C-3PO

An Asteroid Field holds a lot of potential for space encounters. If creatures are willing to risk the asteroids and find a large enough rock, they could hide within the field and wait to ambush unsuspecting foes. The Asteroid Field could also be used as a line of defense for a group that sets up a base of operations inside one of the larger asteroids. Alternatively, the heroes could pick up a distress call from a vessel trapped within the field and try to help it escape. Of course, an Asteroid Field makes a good backdrop for a high-speed chase scene as well.

Asteroid Field Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A Starship begins its turn within an Asteroid Field.

Attack: +12 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Asteroid Field.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 19): The character notices asteroids heading toward the Starship.
  • Pilot (DC 28): The character tries to avoid hitting any asteroids for 1 round, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to the Starship's Reflex Defense to avoid the incoming rocks.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being enters a square occupied by an Animal Trap.
On Trigger

Perception (DC 14): The character detects the trap before they reach it, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Mechanics (DC 24): The character successfully disarms the trap. Survival (DC 19): The character determines which type of creature the trap is designed to capture. For the next hour, the character gains a +1 bonus to attempts to spot that creature.
Special: A creature that gains a Persistent Condition resulting from this Hazard cannot move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

This device is designed to entrap a wild creature.

Used throughout the galaxy, Animal Traps can also catch creatures for which they are not designed. Setting an Animal Trap in the middle of a clearing and baiting it with food might work to catch some carnivorous species, but most traps are hidden in tall grass or similar undergrowth.

Animal Trap Statistics (CL 3)

Keywords: Artificial, Contact

Trigger: A being enters a square occupied by an Animal Trap.

Attack: +5 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 14): The character detects the trap before they reach it, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Mechanics (DC 24): The character successfully disarms the trap.
  • Survival (DC 19): The character determines which type of creature the trap is designed to capture. For the next hour, the character gains a +1 bonus to attempts to spot that creature.

Special: A creature that gains a Persistent Condition resulting from this Hazard cannot move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Avalanche.
Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 18): The character identifies the weak shelf that could cause the Avalanche.
Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is Immobilized under the Avalanche.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The ground rumbles as the surface above you begins cascading down at high speed.

Being caught in an Avalanche during combat is sure to change the nature of battle, as the heroes and their foes scramble to get out of the path of the Avalanche. The sound of a blaster discharge is enough to set an Avalanche in motion, so this Hazard is likely to be triggered by combat.

Avalanche Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.

Attack: +12 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Avalanche.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 18): The character identifies the weak shelf that could cause the Avalanche.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is Immobilized under the Avalanche.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Vehicle begins its turn in an Acidic Storm.
On Trigger; descending through an Acidic Storm takes three rounds.
Pilot (DC 23): The character reduces the number of rounds it takes to pass through the Acidic Storm by 1 round.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See Also: Hazards

Purple lightning flashes out of the dark clouds as you descend toward the planet's surface.

Durace is constantly wracked by Acidic Storms, from which bolts of purple lightning strike out. While the primary effect of such a storm is similar to the Toxic Atmosphere Hazard, Vehicles passing through the area of a violet lightning storm might be struck by the highly charged bolts, which can render a ship inoperable if it does not flee the storm quickly enough.

Acidic Storm Statistics (CL 9)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Energy, Natural

Trigger: A Vehicle begins its turn in an Acidic Storm.

Attack: +11 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger; descending through an Acidic Storm takes three rounds.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Pilot (DC 23): The character reduces the number of rounds it takes to pass through the Acidic Storm by 1 round.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being enters a square adjacent to an Avka Egg.
On Trigger; Once per Avka Egg

Acrobatics (DC 23): Until the end of this movement, the character can enter squares adjacent to unexploded Avka Eggs without triggering the Hazard. Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 18): The character recognizes the rocky outcroppings as Avka Eggs, and knows that the young inside can break out violently. Perception (DC 23): The character notices that there are creatures within the stone outcroppings waiting to emerge.
Special: Each time an Avka Egg is triggered, place an Avka Young in the space the egg once occupied.

changes.value: Hazards, Poisons
A creature is within 2 squares of a Bo'tous Host who releases their Toxin.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Bo'tous Toxin is treated.

Endurance (DC 10): The character holds his or her breath for 1 round, reducing the Bo'tous Toxin's attack roll by 10. Each round the character holds his or her breath in this manner, the check DC increases by 2. Treat Injury (DC 35; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Bo'tous Toxin.

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Homebrew Reference Book: New Jedi Order Campaign Guide

See also: Hazards, Poisons

Bo'tous are tiny mite-like creatures that infest the lungs of living organisms, laying billions of eggs in the lung tissue of their host. The eggs hatch rapidly, destroying the lungs and generally killing their host. When used under proper conditions, Bo'tous Toxin is a subtle and effective weapon by a carefully conditioned assassin.

A single Bo'tous in the lungs will not kill the victim, but it will lay millions of eggs that remain dormant until freed from the host- usually by a forceful and deliberate exhalation (a Standard Action). Once in the atmosphere, the eggs hatch and the tiny creatures looking for new hosts. The host must consciously release the Bo'tous, though in some cases, unwitting victims are brainwashed into releasing it after receiving a particular visual or verbal cue.

Skilled (willing) hosts are capable of producing three successful exhalations (or charges) of toxin, whereas unskilled (unwilling/brainwashed) hosts can only produce one successful exhalation.

Bo'tous Toxin Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Inhaled, Poison

Trigger: A creature is within 2 squares of a Bo'tous Host who releases their Toxin.

Attack: +15 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Bo'tous Toxin is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 10): The character holds his or her breath for 1 round, reducing the Bo'tous Toxin's attack roll by 10. Each round the character holds his or her breath in this manner, the check DC increases by 2.
  • Treat Injury (DC 35; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Bo'tous Toxin.
system.source: New Jedi Order Campaign Guide

changes.value: Hazards, Diseases
A creature is exposed to Borotavi Syndrome.
Whenever the creature moves down the Condition Track.

Special: If the attack exceeds the creature's Fortitude Defense by 5 or more, the creature's Constitution score is instead reduced by 2. If the attack instead exceeds the creature's Fortitude Defense by 10 or more, the creature's Constitution score is reduced by 2, and its Strength score is reduced by 1. If at any time the creature’s Strength or Constitution scores are reduced to 0, the creature dies.

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Homebrew Reference Book: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Jedi Masters (Part 2)

See also: Hazards, Diseases

A rare and often fatal disease, Borotavi Syndrome causes the internal organs to deteriorate and hemorrhage over time. It is often contracted through ingestion of contaminated foods.

Borotavi Syndrome Statistics (CL 15)

Keywords: Disease, Ingested

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Borotavi Syndrome.

Attack: +15 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Whenever the creature moves down the Condition Track.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Constitution (DC 20): If the attack fails when the creature's Constitution and Strength scores aren't penalized by the Borotavi Syndrome, the creature can attempt a Constitution check (one attempt per day, cannot Take 10 or Take 20) to permanently treat their Borotavi Syndrome.
  • Endurance (DC Varies): The character checks their roll against the attack roll to become immune for 24 hours, after which time the creature moves -1 step down the Condition Track. If the creature has had a full eight hours of sleep prior to making the check, it may Take 20.

Special: If the attack exceeds the creature's Fortitude Defense by 5 or more, the creature's Constitution score is instead reduced by 2. If the attack instead exceeds the creature's Fortitude Defense by 10 or more, the creature's Constitution score is reduced by 2, and its Strength score is reduced by 1. If at any time the creature’s Strength or Constitution scores are reduced to 0, the creature dies.

If the attack fails by 5 or more, after eight hours of rest, the character regains 1 point of their Constitution score, up to their normal maximum. If the attack fails by 10 or more, after eight hours of rest the creature regains 1 point of their Strength and Constitution scores, up to their normal maximum.
system.source: Clone Wars Saga Edition Fan Sourcebook - Jedi Masters (Part 2)

changes.value: Hazards
A transparisteel window or a wall takes at least 20 points of damage; targets all creatures within a room or corridor where the damaged section is located.
On Trigger

Climb (DC 27): The character grabs a stable object as a Reaction and negates the forced movement. Alternately, if the character is already secured, he or she can grab an adjacent creature and prevent it from being moved by the Building Decompression.
Special: Any creature pulled into the same square as the damaged wall or window is sucked out into the vacuum by this Hazard, and must then face the Vacuum Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

One crack, and suddenly the entire wall blows outward, sucking anyone and anything nearby into the vacuum.

Stray blaster bolts and sabotage are two of the most dangerous things the people of Iol must face. Since each of the buildings on the surface of Iol is pressurized and sealed, any breach in the hull of a surface building usually results in immediate and violent decompression. Even the tiniest crack in a transparisteel window can cause an entire wall to blow out of a building, taking anyone in the room out as well before emergency forcefields can snap into place and restabilize the pressure and atmosphere within a building.

Building Decompression Statistics (CL 14)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A transparisteel window or a wall takes at least 20 points of damage; targets all creatures within a room or corridor where the damaged section is located.

Attack: +16 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Climb (DC 27): The character grabs a stable object as a Reaction and negates the forced movement. Alternately, if the character is already secured, he or she can grab an adjacent creature and prevent it from being moved by the Building Decompression.

Special: Any creature pulled into the same square as the damaged wall or window is sucked out into the vacuum by this Hazard, and must then face the Vacuum Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship begins its turn within the gravity well of a Black Hole.
Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Black Hole's gravity well.

Mechanics (DC 36): The character works diligently to keep the ship from breaking apart, granting the vessel a +2 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Black Hole. Pilot (DC 36): The character fights the severe pull of gravity and flies the Starship toward safety, moving 1 square away from the center of the Hazard. Use Computer (DC 31): The character detects the Black Hole on the Starship's sensors, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to the crew's Mechanics checks and Pilot checks when dealing with the Hazard.

Special: The event horizon for the Black Hole covers an area with a 10-square radius (Starship Scale) centered on the Black Hole's central square. Within the event horizon, missiles and torpedoes are ineffective, and attacks with laser weapons take a -20 penalty.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The gravity well of this collapsed star is so strong that not even light can escape.

Black Holes are among the most dangerous cosmic objects known to exist; even the Star Destroyers of the Empire steer clear of them. What could bring a group of heroes to such a place? Perhaps they must attempt to rescue the crew of a research station being held hostage by pirates, or raid a secret military installation positioned in a barely stable orbit. Combat just on the edge of the event horizon might be possible, but any ship that falls into the gravity well of the Black Hole must escape or fall victim to the Hazard's crushing power.

Black Hole Statistics (CL 20)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A Starship begins its turn within the gravity well of a Black Hole.

Attack: +22 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Black Hole's gravity well.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Mechanics (DC 36): The character works diligently to keep the ship from breaking apart, granting the vessel a +2 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Black Hole.
  • Pilot (DC 36): The character fights the severe pull of gravity and flies the Starship toward safety, moving 1 square away from the center of the Hazard.
  • Use Computer (DC 31): The character detects the Black Hole on the Starship's sensors, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to the crew's Mechanics checks and Pilot checks when dealing with the Hazard.

Special: The event horizon for the Black Hole covers an area with a 10-square radius (Starship Scale) centered on the Black Hole's central square. Within the event horizon, missiles and torpedoes are ineffective, and attacks with laser weapons take a -20 penalty.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn in the Blizzard.
Hourly, until the being leaves the Blizzard.

Endurance (DC 24): The character forces themselves to move through the storm, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Blizzard. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 14): The character identifies the Blizzard before it reaches them.
Special: A Blizzard grants Concealment to beings and objects within it.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A severe snowstorm blinds you and makes it difficult for you to move.

Traveling through a Blizzard without outside aid can easily cause a group of heroes to stray off course and become lost. With the large amount of snow falling during such a storm, even sensors and radios become less effective. If the heroes are trying to find their way back to a ship or a base, they might suffer the frustration of knowing that they are close but are still unable to penetrate the storm.

A Blizzard is a good way to sneak in surprises for a party of heroes trekking across frozen plains. For example, a well-hidden Wampa or a squad of enemies might lurk just behind some large snowdrifts, or another Hazard such as a Frozen Lake can increase the danger.

Blizzard Statistics (CL 3)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn in the Blizzard.

Attack: +5 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Hourly, until the being leaves the Blizzard.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 24): The character forces themselves to move through the storm, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Blizzard.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 14): The character identifies the Blizzard before it reaches them.

Special: A Blizzard grants Concealment to beings and objects within it.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

Blue Harvest is an Illegal and highly concentrated derivative of the FEX-M3 Nerve Toxin. It is so powerful that contact with the skin is enough to cause a massive systemic overload that could shut down the body. The sweet and exotic smell of Blue Harvest is its only identifying feature.

The Imperial assassin Cabe used Blue Harvest to kill the New Republic Senator Luralon Odaay and later, the prostitute who had witnessed his death, Kandi. A dose of Blue Harvest costs 3,000 credits.

The cave quakes violently, causing heavy stones to crash down to the dusty floor.

In tight underground quarters, a Cave-In can be especially dangerous. The Hazard might be triggered during a subterranean battle, or it could occur at an appropriate moment in a story arc. For example, the ceiling might come down as the heroes are about to reach their final destination, delaying their progress.

  • Perception (DC 23): The character realizes that the rock ceiling might be weak enough to collapse if a loud sound occurs within the cavern.

changes.value: Hazards
A creature or Droid begins its turn in the Crowd.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is in the Crowd.

Knowledge (Social Sciences) (DC 24): The character predicts the direction in which various elements within the crowd will move, gaining a +5 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Crowd. Persuasion (DC 19): The character convinces the crowd to clear a path for the character and his or her allies, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Crowd.

Special: The general Attitude of the Crowd can help or hinder the efforts of creatures trying to move through it. The table below determines the modifiers (if any) that creatures receive on attempts to make their way through a Crowd.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A multitude of beings assembled in one place threaten to block your way, sweep you along, or trample you.

Crowd Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Artificial

Trigger: A creature or Droid begins its turn in the Crowd.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is in the Crowd.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Social Sciences) (DC 24): The character predicts the direction in which various elements within the crowd will move, gaining a +5 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Crowd.
  • Persuasion (DC 19): The character convinces the crowd to clear a path for the character and his or her allies, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Crowd.

Special: The general Attitude of the Crowd can help or hinder the efforts of creatures trying to move through it. The table below determines the modifiers (if any) that creatures receive on attempts to make their way through a Crowd.

Crowd Attitude Steps
ATTITUDE EFFECT ON CROWD
Hostile +5 bonus to attack roll and +1d10 points of damage
Unfriendly +2 bonus to attack roll
Indifferent No effect
Friendly -2 penalty to attack roll
Helpful -5 penalty to attack roll and -1d10 points of damage
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

A being stands in Crashing Waves on the Hazard's Initiative Count.
Each round, on Initiative Count (Initiative +5)
Acrobatics (DC 13): The character can make a Acrobatics check as a Reaction to avoid being knocked Prone by the waves.

Special: Crashing Waves occur along the shore of an ocean, an inland sea, or another large body of water. When placing this Hazard, the GM should choose a direction from which the waves come. This is the direction in which targets affected by the Hazard are pulled.

changes.value: Hazards
A being enters a square within 3 squares of a Carnivorous Plant.
Each round at the end of the target's turn, while the being remains within 3 squares of the Carnivorous Plant.

Acrobatics (DC 22): As a Reaction, the character avoids being Grabbed when attacked by the plant, but they still take damage. Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 22): The character identifies the Carnivorous Plant, and knows that it will attack if they get too close, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Stealth (DC 27): When the character begins their turn within 3 squares of the Carnivorous Plant, the character avoids being detected by the Hazard for 1 round.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is Grabbed and pulled toward the plant at a rate of 1 square per round. If the target reaches the Carnivorous Plant, the target is swallowed and can be freed only by destroying the Carnivorous Plant (Reflex Defense 8, Fortitude Defense 14).

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A large plant uses its vinelike tentacles to consume living creatures.

Beings that erect permanent installations in forests or jungles often place Carnivorous Plants along commonly used paths as natural guardians and as a first line of defense against interlopers. Some beings might even bring them indoors for extra security.

Carnivorous Plants Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being enters a square within 3 squares of a Carnivorous Plant.

Attack: +8 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the end of the target's turn, while the being remains within 3 squares of the Carnivorous Plant.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 22): As a Reaction, the character avoids being Grabbed when attacked by the plant, but they still take damage.
  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 22): The character identifies the Carnivorous Plant, and knows that it will attack if they get too close, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Stealth (DC 27): When the character begins their turn within 3 squares of the Carnivorous Plant, the character avoids being detected by the Hazard for 1 round.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is Grabbed and pulled toward the plant at a rate of 1 square per round. If the target reaches the Carnivorous Plant, the target is swallowed and can be freed only by destroying the Carnivorous Plant (Reflex Defense 8, Fortitude Defense 14).

A being begins its turn in within 3 squares of a Dust Devil.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within 3 squares of the Dust Devil.

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character reduces the effects of being thrown by the Dust Devil's special effect, taking half damage if the Hazard hits the character and one-quarter damage if it misses. Perception (DC 16): The character spots the Dust Devil before it reaches them.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, at the end of the round, the target is sucked into the whirlwind and thrown 12 squares. Upon landing, the target takes an additional 3d8 points of damage.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A huge whirlwind of dust and sand threatens to engulf you.

A Dust Devil can draw in just about anything. Most creatures that hear its unmistakable whistling winds and notice its obvious presence will do everything in their power to avoid it. A Dust Devil is best used in situations when the heroes cannot flee, such as during a climactic battle at the end of a long journey. While the combat rages, the whirlwind can cut a path across the battlefield, attacking everything in its way.

Keywords: Area, Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn in within 3 squares of a Dust Devil.

Attack: +7 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within 3 squares of the Dust Devil.

  • Perception (DC 16): The character spots the Dust Devil before it reaches them.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, at the end of the round, the target is sucked into the whirlwind and thrown 12 squares. Upon landing, the target takes an additional 3d8 points of damage.

changes.value: Hazards
An opening is created between outer space and a compartment containing creatures; targets any creature within the area of Depressurization.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is within the area of Depressurization.
Endurance (DC 22): The character manages to control his or her breathing despite the decreasing amount of air in the area, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the hazard.
Special: After 1d6+4 rounds, the air is completely vented, changing the hazard to atmosphere, Vacuum.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The air in your compartment rushes into the vacuum of space.

Intentionally depressurizing a room is a last-ditch strategy, since it often results in death for anyone in the chamber at the time. But desperate combatants can try to use the Hazard to their advantage during battle. For example, they can force their enemies into space, or they can escape from the depressurizing room through an airlock into a normal area and seal the hatch behind them.

Depressurization Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Artificial

Trigger: An opening is created between outer space and a compartment containing creatures; targets any creature within the area of Depressurization.

Attack: +9 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is within the area of Depressurization.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 22): The character manages to control his or her breathing despite the decreasing amount of air in the area, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the hazard.

Special: After 1d6+4 rounds, the air is completely vented, changing the hazard to atmosphere, Vacuum.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards, Diseases

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Hazards, Diseases

Keywords: Disease

Challenge Level: 8

The Death Seed Plague is a dangerous disease caused by parasitic Droch. A creature infected with Death Seed Plague moves -1 Persistent step down the Condition Track and takes a -5 penalty to its Fortitude Defense. If the Droch's initial Bite attack is successful, the attack occurs each day (1d20+1) the disease remains untreated (The penalty to Fortitude Defense is not cumulative). If the plague moves the creature to the bottom of the Condition Track, the creature dies.

The Persistent Condition remains as long as the disease is untreated, and treating the disease requires a successful DC 25 Treat Injury check. Using a Bacta Tank reduces the Treat Injury DC to 15.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

A Carnivorous Plant lashes out at a nearby creature, trying to drain it of its life essence.

Durace is home to many species of meat-eating plants. Though fauna is rare on the planet, these plants can consume creatures of up to Large size, living on the nutrition taken from those creatures for years at a time.

The Twi'lek Poisoner carries four vials of a distilled and refined chemical weapon called trihexalon. Normally used as a chemical weapon, trihexalon can be refined and altered to react (Or fail to react) with certain biochemical compositions. The Twi'lek Poisoner's Distilled Trihexalon is engineered to affect all non-Twi'leks, preventing the poison from being used against her.

The metal fence before you crackles with energy.

This Hazard can be as simple as an electrified chain-link fence, or it can take forms such as a powered metal wall, a series of lethal laser beams spanning the gap between relay posts, or a force field that seals off a particular area up to a certain height. Combatants can use the Hazard to keep their opponents at bay while firing at them from relative safety. The Hazard can also keep creatures confined to a specific area and prevent them from fleeing.

changes.value: Hazards
A creature is exposed to Extreme Heat or Cold.
Hourly, as long as the target remains exposed to Extreme Heat or Cold.

Special: A creature that has taken damage from Extreme Heat or Cold cannot regain Hit Points or move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour in a normal environment. Heavy clothing or armor provides a +5 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist Extreme Cold, but imposes a -5 penalty to Fortitude Defense to resist Extreme Heat.

system.description:
See also: Hazards

Extreme Heat or Cold can punish those who are unprepared for it.

Extreme Heat or Cold Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Extreme Heat or Cold.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Hourly, as long as the target remains exposed to Extreme Heat or Cold.

Special: A creature that has taken damage from Extreme Heat or Cold cannot regain Hit Points or move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour in a normal environment. Heavy clothing or armor provides a +5 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense to resist Extreme Cold, but imposes a -5 penalty to Fortitude Defense to resist Extreme Heat.

Additional Extreme Heat or Cold Data

Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Rebellion Era Campaign Guide

Extreme Heat or Cold that would be sufficient to harm or kill a creature or Droid might not affect Vehicles and other machines, since most are designed to function under extreme conditions. However, in some situations, the weather on a planet might be so severe that it interferes with mechanical systems. In these cases, Gamemasters can use the following rules to represent the effects of Extreme Temperatures on Vehicles. These rules should not be applied to creatures or Droids, which are covered above.

Each minute a Vehicle operates in Extreme Heat or Cold, make an attack roll (1d20+10) against the Vehicle's Fortitude Defense. If the attack succeeds, the Vehicle moves -1 Persistent step down the Condition Track. This Persistent Condition can be removed only if the Vehicle receives Repairs.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Rebellion Era Campaign Guide

changes.value: Hazards
An attack misses a square adjacent to the Exposed Plasma Conduit.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to the Exposed Plasma Conduit.

Jump (DC 23): The character leaps over or away from the spilled plasma, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Treat Injury (DC 18; Requires Medpac): The character treats an injured creature for plasma burns. Use Computer (DC 28): The character slices into the control network and diverts the plasma flow away from the area, negating the Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A channel for moving superheated plasma has been ruptured, spilling its contents into the open.

Plasma conduits are most commonly encountered within manufacturing facilities or power plants, but they can appear anywhere that plasma is used. Since the means of transporting this superheated material must be very strong to prevent its accidental release, ruptures are rare. Most of the time, combatants who seek to use this Hazard to their advantage will create it by shooting the conduit themselves. Then they use the unexpected danger as a diversion to keep their enemies occupied while they flee, or they let the plasma create a means of escape by burning through the floor.

Exposed Plasma Conduit Statistics (CL 9)

Keywords: Artificial or Natural, Contact, Fire

Trigger: An attack misses a square adjacent to the Exposed Plasma Conduit.

Attack: +11 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to the Exposed Plasma Conduit.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 23): The character leaps over or away from the spilled plasma, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Treat Injury (DC 18; Requires Medpac): The character treats an injured creature for plasma burns.
  • Use Computer (DC 28): The character slices into the control network and diverts the plasma flow away from the area, negating the Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Homebrew Reference Book: Corporate Sector Sourcebook

See also: Poisons, Hazards

FEX-M3 is an Illegal nerve toxin used extensively by bounty hunters and members of The Assassins' Guild. Usually delivered as the coating on a poison dart, this toxin can kill a target silently in less than 10 seconds, by causing the brain to release its stored energy, thus boiling the target's brain.

Boba Fett used darts laced with this substance on his knee pad dart launchers. The Imperial military used it with the CSPL-12 Projectile Launcher. A dose of FEX-M3 costs 1,000 credits.
