changes.value: Poisons, Hazards
A creature comes into contact with Falsin's Rot.
Daily, until Falsin's Rot is treated.
Treat Injury (DC 20; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats Falsin's Rot.
Special: A character who remains at -3 steps on the Condition Track for two days as a result of Falsin's Rot permanently loses the use of an affected limb.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy of Intrigue

See also: Poisons, Hazards

Named after the fungus's first recorded victim, Falsin's Rot is a much-feared parasite that is rare in Nyriaan's more civilized locations. It begins as a spore that can take root anywhere on a subject's skin, although infections usually begin on the extremities. Painful, itching lesions form as the fungus multiplies, spreading along the limbs and onto the victim's torso and abdomen. If left alone, Falsin's Rot consumes a subject in less than a standard week.

Although deadly in the earliest days of Nyriaan's colonization, Falsin's Rot can be treated and cured. Treatment consists of applications of salves concocted from combinations of local flora and standard medicinal compounds, such as bacta. If treated early, few signs of the infection remain. Victims of advanced cases exhibit severe scarring, with the worst cases resulting in limb loss.

Falsin's Rot Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Contact, Natural, Poison

Trigger: A creature comes into contact with Falsin's Rot.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Daily, until Falsin's Rot is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 20; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats Falsin's Rot.

Special: A character who remains at -3 steps on the Condition Track for two days as a result of Falsin's Rot permanently loses the use of an affected limb.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy of Intrigue

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on the Frozen Lake; targeting every being and object in a 4x4-square area.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Frozen Lake.

Jump (DC 27): The character attempts to leap across the weakened area of the ice, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Perception (DC 22): The character locates a weakness in the frozen surface and surmise that too much weight could cause it to break.
Special: A being that falls through the ice and is subsequently rescued cannot regain Hit Points until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The opposite shore of the Frozen Lake appears quite distant, but the hard surface looks safe enough.

On a frigid world such as Csilla or Hoth, the chances of a character breaking through a thick layer of ice while walking across the frozen surface of a lake seem slim. This Hazard, however, represents a series of underwater geysers that have been heated by the planet's core and shoot boiling water up toward the surface. As a result, the ice covering the lake has become thin and weakened in areas. Since the superheated water rises in random locations, any part of the lake's surface might be affected. At any time, a creature moving across the surface might step onto a thin patch of ice and fall through.

Frozen Lake Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on the Frozen Lake; targeting every being and object in a 4x4-square area.

Attack: +8 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Frozen Lake.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 27): The character attempts to leap across the weakened area of the ice, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 22): The character locates a weakness in the frozen surface and surmise that too much weight could cause it to break.

Special: A being that falls through the ice and is subsequently rescued cannot regain Hit Points until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A target touches Flash Moss with enough pressure to set off its defenses (Such as stepping on it or hitting it); targeting every being and object within a 6x6-square area.
Every 1d6 hours.

Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 19): The character identifies the nature of the Flash Moss, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 14): The character spots the Flash Moss as they draw closer to it, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A seemingly harmless plant flashes a bright light when it is touched.

Flash Moss is a plant most often found in deep swamps, where light barely breaks through the canopy to reach the ground. Creatures can exploit the plant's natural defense mechanism- a bright flash of light in the face of a threat- in a number of ways.

If a creature is properly prepared, the flash of light can be used to illuminate the surroundings. Crafty creatures can use the moss to blind their opponents. The moss can be paired with another Hazard, such as a Sinkhole or Strangle Vines, to blind a creature and make the creature more likely to fall victim to the second Hazard.

Flash Moss Statistics (CL 3)

Keywords: Area, Contact, Energy, Natural

Trigger: A target touches Flash Moss with enough pressure to set off its defenses (Such as stepping on it or hitting it); targeting every being and object within a 6x6-square area.

Attack: +5 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Every 1d6 hours.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 19): The character identifies the nature of the Flash Moss, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 14): The character spots the Flash Moss as they draw closer to it, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within a Flooded River.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Flooded River.

Survival (DC 21): The character locates the narrowest point at which to cross the river. The character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Swim (DC 26): The character swims at its normal swim speed, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is swept up in the current, moves downstream at a rate of 6 squares per round, and is unable to control the direction of its movement.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The water in the river is high, and the current is strong enough to sweep you away.

Combining a Flooded River Hazard with a Waterfall Hazard adds an extra level of risk for any creatures caught up in the flow, especially if they are involved in combat in the water and are not paying attention to where they are going.

Flooded River Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within a Flooded River.

Attack: +6 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Flooded River.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Survival (DC 21): The character locates the narrowest point at which to cross the river. The character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Swim (DC 26): The character swims at its normal swim speed, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target is swept up in the current, moves downstream at a rate of 6 squares per round, and is unable to control the direction of its movement.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
The encounter begins, or a predetermined round number begins (Gamemaster's choice)
Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +8) for 10 Rounds

Acrobatics (DC 22): As a Reaction to being hit by this Hazard's attack, the character can make an Acrobatics check to keep from being Knocked Prone. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 17): The character recognizes the area as one susceptible to flash flooding. Swim (DC 17): The character makes this check as a part of a Move Action, and if successful can Swim as normal in the flooded area (This skill can only be used after five rounds of flooding).

Special: Each round that it attacks after the first round, the Flash Flood gains a cumulative +1 bonus to its attack rolls. After three rounds, the water is rushing into the area at knee height to a Human; after five rounds, the water is at waist height; and after ten rounds the water is higher than an average Human's head. After ten rounds, the area is effectively flooded, and Gamemasters can either allow heroes to Swim as normal or use the Flooded River Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Water begins to trickle across the ground slowly, then grows into a rush as flood waters push their way across the ground at breakneck pace.

The nature of the landscape on Volik lends itself to Flash Floods. While most of the time this does no more harm than washing away some hidden cache of weapon and contraband, in the right spot a Flash Flood can turn a once-dry plain into a quick-flowing river in a matter of seconds. Gamemasters can use the Hazard to represent Flash Floods that spring up when the heroes are engaged in a combat encounter. The area of the Flash Flood can start small and grow over time, or the entire area of the battlefield could be subjected to the Flash Flood Hazard.

Flash Flood Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: The encounter begins, or a predetermined round number begins (Gamemaster's choice)

Attack: +7 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +8) for 10 Rounds

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 22): As a Reaction to being hit by this Hazard's attack, the character can make an Acrobatics check to keep from being Knocked Prone.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 17): The character recognizes the area as one susceptible to flash flooding.
  • Swim (DC 17): The character makes this check as a part of a Move Action, and if successful can Swim as normal in the flooded area (This skill can only be used after five rounds of flooding).

Special: Each round that it attacks after the first round, the Flash Flood gains a cumulative +1 bonus to its attack rolls. After three rounds, the water is rushing into the area at knee height to a Human; after five rounds, the water is at waist height; and after ten rounds the water is higher than an average Human's head. After ten rounds, the area is effectively flooded, and Gamemasters can either allow heroes to Swim as normal or use the Flooded River Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being is forcibly moved, such as with a Bantha Rush or by a [Telekinetic] Force Power.
On Trigger

Climb (DC 16): As a Reaction, the character can make a Climb check to negate the additional movement by grabbing onto something solid. If no stable object is nearby, the Climb skill cannot be used in this way.
Special: Floating Away can move a target vertically as well as horizontally. When moved upward, the target immediately falls back down to the height at which it began without taking Falling Damage.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A good push is all it takes to send someone careening across the surface of Iol.

On planets with low gravity like Iol, there is always a danger that, when outside of the controlled gravity of artificial structures one might float away from the planet if given a sufficient push. Though Iol's gravity is strong enough to keep moving surface-travelers from floating out into the blackness of space, it is light enough that a creature that is sufficiently pushed will drift for some distance before landing.

Floating Away Statistics (CL 5)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being is forcibly moved, such as with a Bantha Rush or by a [Telekinetic] Force Power.

Attack: +7 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Climb (DC 16): As a Reaction, the character can make a Climb check to negate the additional movement by grabbing onto something solid. If no stable object is nearby, the Climb skill cannot be used in this way.

Special: Floating Away can move a target vertically as well as horizontally. When moved upward, the target immediately falls back down to the height at which it began without taking Falling Damage.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being enters a square containing or adjacent to a Forgotten Mine; targeting the triggering being and any being in a square adjacent to the Mine.
On Trigger; Once per Mine

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character makes this check as a part of a Move Action; if the check succeeds, the character can enter squares adjacent to a Mine during that Move Action without triggering the Hazard.

Special: Each Mine in the Forgotten Minefield should take up 1 square. There should be at least 1 Mine per hero placed in the encounter area, plus additional Mines for particularly large battlefields.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Unseen explosive devices beneath the surface are triggered by creatures moving across the mines' trigger zones.

As a result of the ongoing conflict between the Altiri and the Anarrians, there are many locations across the world that have been seeded with explosives as a deterrent against invasion. However, many times these minefields are left unmarked and are forgotten until some unaware citizen stumbles across a hidden mine. The following hazard can be used to add some spice to a combat encounter on Altiria/Anarris, giving the heroes reason to be extra cautious during their movement across the battlefield.

Forgotten Minefield Statistics (CL 13)

Keywords: Area, Artificial, Contact, Energy, Fire

Trigger: A being enters a square containing or adjacent to a Forgotten Mine; targeting the triggering being and any being in a square adjacent to the Mine.

Attack: +15 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger; Once per Mine

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 26): The character makes this check as a part of a Move Action; if the check succeeds, the character can enter squares adjacent to a Mine during that Move Action without triggering the Hazard.

Special: Each Mine in the Forgotten Minefield should take up 1 square. There should be at least 1 Mine per hero placed in the encounter area, plus additional Mines for particularly large battlefields.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being or object begins its turn in the Freezing Rain.
Every 10 minutes, until the being leaves the Freezing Rain.

Endurance (DC 26): The character forces themselves to move through the storm, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Freezing Rain. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 16): The character identifies the Freezing Rain before it reaches them.
Special: A being that gains a Persistent Condition resulting from this Hazard cannot move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

You are pelted by tiny pieces of ice and drenched by rain that chills you to the bone.

Not only does Freezing Rain affect unprotected creatures caught in the middle of the storm, but the precipitation coats objects, including buildings and vehicles, with ice that makes their use more difficult. Due to the inconvenience this Hazard causes, Freezing Rain makes a good cover through which enemies can approach a group of heroes or an unsuspecting installation.

Freezing Rain Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A being or object begins its turn in the Freezing Rain.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Every 10 minutes, until the being leaves the Freezing Rain.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 26): The character forces themselves to move through the storm, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Freezing Rain.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 16): The character identifies the Freezing Rain before it reaches them.

Special: A being that gains a Persistent Condition resulting from this Hazard cannot move up the Condition Track until it spends at least 1 hour resting in a normal environment.

Any object exposed to this Hazard for at least 1 hour becomes difficult to use because of ice build-up; until the ice is removed, attack rolls and skill checks that involve the use of the affected object take a -2 penalty.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship's Pilot end his or her turn within a square filled by Heavy Fog
On Trigger

Perception (DC 31): A Copilot can use the Perception skill to give the Starship a +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against this Hazard, warning the Pilot about getting too close to a rock formation. Pilot (DC 26): As a Reaction, the Pilot of a Starship can make a Pilot check to Avoid Collision. A successful check causes the Starship to take half damage from the Collision. Use Computer (DC 21): As a Standard Action, the character can use the ship's sensors to try and pierce the fog and find a safe route around the jutting plateaus. Success grants a +5 circumstance bonus to the Starship's Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Thick fog covers the surface of O'reen, providing a good place for criminals to hide but also concealing the towering stone structures from those who ply the mist.

Much of the ground level of O'reen is covered in a perpetual heavy fog. Most O'reenian cities are built atop tall mesas and plateaus, meaning that most travelers don't have to deal with the Heavy Fog. However, the few, rare criminals on O'reen often fly their Starships through the Heavy Fog, staying below visual range and navigating by sensors alone. The practice is dangerous, and more than a few ships have had deadly collisions with the towering mesas.

Heavy Fog Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A Starship's Pilot end his or her turn within a square filled by Heavy Fog

Attack: +14 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 31): A Copilot can use the Perception skill to give the Starship a +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against this Hazard, warning the Pilot about getting too close to a rock formation.
  • Pilot (DC 26): As a Reaction, the Pilot of a Starship can make a Pilot check to Avoid Collision. A successful check causes the Starship to take half damage from the Collision.
  • Use Computer (DC 21): As a Standard Action, the character can use the ship's sensors to try and pierce the fog and find a safe route around the jutting plateaus. Success grants a +5 circumstance bonus to the Starship's Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Icy Cave-In.

Acrobatics (DC 28): As a Move Action, a character can make an Acrobatics check to gain a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against a falling ice attack made against the character at the start of his or her next turn. Perception (DC 23): A character notices that the roof of the ice cavern is unstable and believes that a loud noise could cause a cave-in.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The underground ice caverns af Csilla shake and rumble, sending heavy blocks of ice crashing to the ground.

Icy Cave-In Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.

Attack: +10 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Icy Cave-In.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 28): As a Move Action, a character can make an Acrobatics check to gain a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against a falling ice attack made against the character at the start of his or her next turn.
  • Perception (DC 23): A character notices that the roof of the ice cavern is unstable and believes that a loud noise could cause a cave-in.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being or Wheeled Vehicle moves into the Icy Ground.
On Trigger

Jump (DC 19): The character leaps over the ice, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Pilot (DC 14): When operating a Wheeled Vehicle, the character maintains control of the vehicle even if the Hazard's attack is successful. Stealth (DC 24): Using the same technique used for moving silently, the character can move at half speed and is not affected by the Hazard's attack.

Special: Immediately after the Hazard's successful attack, the target is knocked Prone, ending its Move Action. The target must spend a Move Action to stand up. As the target attempts to regain its footing, the Hazard makes an Attack of Opportunity against the target with a -5 penalty. If the attack is successful, the target slips on the ice and falls Prone again, but it takes no extra damage.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The slick surface of the ice makes any movement a gamble.

Attacks made by this hazard can be avoided if the target is using equipment that grants better traction on icy surfaces. Spiked footwear, for example, provides a hero with the means to keep his or her balance on slippery surfaces and to avoid the Hazard's attack. Heroes riding in a vehicle that does not touch the ground are not affected by the Hazard's attack.

Icy Ground Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Artificial or Natural

Trigger: A being or Wheeled Vehicle moves into the Icy Ground.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 19): The character leaps over the ice, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Pilot (DC 14): When operating a Wheeled Vehicle, the character maintains control of the vehicle even if the Hazard's attack is successful.
  • Stealth (DC 24): Using the same technique used for moving silently, the character can move at half speed and is not affected by the Hazard's attack.

Special: Immediately after the Hazard's successful attack, the target is knocked Prone, ending its Move Action. The target must spend a Move Action to stand up. As the target attempts to regain its footing, the Hazard makes an Attack of Opportunity against the target with a -5 penalty. If the attack is successful, the target slips on the ice and falls Prone again, but it takes no extra damage.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within an Insect Swarm.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Insect Swarm.

Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 14): The character identifies the Insect Swarm. Survival (DC 19): The character realizes that entering a body of water or a sealed environment is the best way to avoid the Insect Swarm.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A dark cloud rapidly approaches, alang with a law buzzing sound that gradually increases in volume.

Tiny insects are common in swamps. On their own, they are merely a nuisance, but in large groups they become mare dangerous. Insect Swarms can be a diversion, good for distracting pursuers while giving the pursued time to regroup. Swarms can also ruin the aim of combatants, drawing their attention away from intended targets as they brush the bugs aside.

Insect Swarm Statistics (CL 3)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within an Insect Swarm.

Attack: +5 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Insect Swarm.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 14): The character identifies the Insect Swarm.
  • Survival (DC 19): The character realizes that entering a body of water or a sealed environment is the best way to avoid the Insect Swarm.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards, Poisons
A creature ingests Bundar Root.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Irksh Poison is treated.
Treat Injury (DC 28; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Irksh Poison.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy of Intrigue

See also: Hazards, Poisons

Irksh Poison is a deadly substance created by the Yuuzhan Vong for their undercover agents to use on themselves in case they are captured.

Irksh Poison Statistics (CL 13)

Keywords: Ingested, Poison

Trigger: A creature ingests Bundar Root.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Irksh Poison is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 28; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Irksh Poison.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy of Intrigue

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on the Icy Cliffs.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the being remains on the Icy Cliffs.

Acrobatics (DC 18): The character uses tumbling skills to slow their descent, reducing the distance they fall by 3 meters. Climb (DC 32): The character ascends the Icy Cliffs more effectively, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Knowledge (Tactics) (DC 23): The character plots a course up the cliffs that minimizes the effects of the Hazard, granting everyone in the party a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
Special: Any being that is successfully attacked by the Hazard loses its grip on the Icy Cliffs and falls.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A jagged wall of ice and rock looms over you.

Although the heights of different Icy Cliffs can vary, an Icy Cliff must be at least 10 meters tall to qualify as a Hazard of this type.

Icy Cliffs Statistics (CL 9)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on the Icy Cliffs.

Attack: +11 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the being remains on the Icy Cliffs.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 18): The character uses tumbling skills to slow their descent, reducing the distance they fall by 3 meters.
  • Climb (DC 32): The character ascends the Icy Cliffs more effectively, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Knowledge (Tactics) (DC 23): The character plots a course up the cliffs that minimizes the effects of the Hazard, granting everyone in the party a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: Any being that is successfully attacked by the Hazard loses its grip on the Icy Cliffs and falls.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Ground Vehicle ends its turn in a Jagged Sinkhole, or any Vehicle lands in a Jagged Sinkhole.
Each round, on Initiative Count (Initiative +8)

Perception (DC 22): The character recognizes the Jagged Sinkhole. Pilot (DC 22): Using the Vehicle's drive systems, the character is able to dislodge the ship from the Jagged Sinkhole. This Skill Check requires a Move Action; if the check is successful, the Vehicle can move as normal. Use the Force (DC Varies): The Move Object Force Power can be used to pull a trapped Vehicle out of the Jagged Sinkhole.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The Vehicle slowly begins to sink into the rocks upon which it sits. Jagged shards of volcanic rock dig into the hull of the Vehicle, grinding and tearing holes as it slips further below the surface.

Vehicles that land on the surface of Durace may sink into the jagged volcanic rock that appears to be solid but actually hides a deep sinkhole.

Jagged Sinkhole Statistics (CL 9)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A Ground Vehicle ends its turn in a Jagged Sinkhole, or any Vehicle lands in a Jagged Sinkhole.

Attack: +9 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round, on Initiative Count (Initiative +8)

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 22): The character recognizes the Jagged Sinkhole.
  • Pilot (DC 22): Using the Vehicle's drive systems, the character is able to dislodge the ship from the Jagged Sinkhole. This Skill Check requires a Move Action; if the check is successful, the Vehicle can move as normal.
  • Use the Force (DC Varies): The Move Object Force Power can be used to pull a trapped Vehicle out of the Jagged Sinkhole.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Poisons, Hazards
A creature is exposed to Korfaise.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Korfaise.
Special: After spending at least 1 round outside of the Korfaise gas, the creature's Speed returns to normal.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

See also: Poisons, Hazards

Korfaise is a substance used as a coolant for Starships. It appears as a white gas, which rapidly fill the environment, as it is lighter than air.

Korfaise Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Artificial, Atmosphere

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Korfaise.

Attack: +4 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Korfaise.

Special: After spending at least 1 round outside of the Korfaise gas, the creature's Speed returns to normal.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

changes.value: Hazards, Diseases
A creature is exposed to the Krytos Virus.
Daily, until the Krytos Virus is treated.
Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Krytos Virus. Treat Injury (DC 21 (DC 16 with Bacta Tank); Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Krytos Virus.

Special: The Krytos Virus takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls against Humans. Once a creature has been exposed to the Krytos Virus and the Disease has been treated, that creature can not contract the Disease again.

system.description:
See also: Hazards, Diseases

This genetically engineered virus was produced by the Empire to target non-Humans.

Krytos Virus Statistics (CL 5)

Keywords: Artificial, Atmosphere, Disease

Trigger: A creature is exposed to the Krytos Virus.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Daily, until the Krytos Virus is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Krytos Virus.
  • Treat Injury (DC 21 (DC 16 with Bacta Tank); Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Krytos Virus.

Special: The Krytos Virus takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls against Humans. Once a creature has been exposed to the Krytos Virus and the Disease has been treated, that creature can not contract the Disease again.

changes.value: Poisons, Hazards
A creature ingests Knockout Drugs.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Knockout Drugs are treated.
Treat Injury (DC 15; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Knockout Drugs.

system.description:
See also: Poisons, Hazards

When put into food or drink, this Poison renders a target unconscious.

Knockout Drugs Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Artificial, Ingested, Poison

Trigger: A creature ingests Knockout Drugs.

Attack: +4 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Knockout Drugs are treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 15; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Knockout Drugs.

changes.value: Poisons, Hazards
A creature ingests Kryotin.
Once every minute for 10 minutes.

Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 31): The character identifies the chemical as the narcotic substance known as Kryotin. Perception (DC 26): The character recognizes the signs that an individual creature is under the effects of Kryotin. Treat Injury (DC 21; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Kryotin. This process takes 8 hours and removes the Persistent Condition caused by Kryotin.
Special: Until the Persistent Condition caused by Kryotin is removed, the target doubles all Condition Track penalties to Will Defense.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Poisons, Hazards

This narcotic substance instills a strong sense of euphoria in the subject, making him or her susceptible to suggestion.

One of the oldest narcotic agents known to the galaxy, Kryotin is outlawed by every major galactic government since the days of The Old Republic. Even The Galactic Empire seeks to keep the drug from becoming too prominent, especially among the military forces.

Kryotin functions by causing the user's brain to release a sudden rush of chemicals that bring on a state of euphoria and that also make the victim greatly susceptible to suggestion. While some use it for recreational purposes, it can also be used in interrogation and brainwashing. The following Hazard can be used to represent the effects of Kryotin on a living creature.

Kryotin Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Ingested, Natural, Poison

Trigger: A creature ingests Kryotin.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Once every minute for 10 minutes.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 31): The character identifies the chemical as the narcotic substance known as Kryotin.
  • Perception (DC 26): The character recognizes the signs that an individual creature is under the effects of Kryotin.
  • Treat Injury (DC 21; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Kryotin. This process takes 8 hours and removes the Persistent Condition caused by Kryotin.

Special: Until the Persistent Condition caused by Kryotin is removed, the target doubles all Condition Track penalties to Will Defense.

Each day that a creature with a Persistent Condition caused by Kryotin goes without a dose of Kryotin, the creature moves - 1 step on the Condition Track at the start of the day. After 10 days without ingesting Kryotin, the Persistent Condition is removed.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn adjacent to a Lava Flow.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains adjacent to the Lava Flow.

Acrobatics (DC 27): The character tumbles away from the Lava Flow, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Jump (DC 27): The character jumps over or away from the Lava Flow, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 22): The character can predict how the Lava Flow will move; the character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
Special: Any being or object touched by the lava catches Fire and takes an additional 1d6 points of Fire damage each round until the Fire is extinguished.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The dark orange glow and blistering heat of the lava are warnings that you should stay away.

Virtually every planet in the galaxy has magma at its core, and lava can appear just about anywhere, including underground. A Lava Flow makes a good barrier. Placing a subterranean stronghold on an island surrounded by a lava moat challenges the heroes to find a different entrance. A bridge above a Lava Flow makes an exciting location for a battle as the heroes struggle to stay out of the searing magma while trying to defeat their enemies.

Lava Flow Statistics (CL 15)

Keywords: Fire, Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn adjacent to a Lava Flow.

Attack: +17 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains adjacent to the Lava Flow.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 27): The character tumbles away from the Lava Flow, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Jump (DC 27): The character jumps over or away from the Lava Flow, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 22): The character can predict how the Lava Flow will move; the character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: Any being or object touched by the lava catches Fire and takes an additional 1d6 points of Fire damage each round until the Fire is extinguished.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within an area containing Leeches.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Leeches are removed.
Treat Injury (DC 19): The character safely removes the Leeches.
Special: Leeches ignore the effects of a creature's armor, unless the armor is natural or airtight.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Tiny parasites attach to your skin and suck your fluids for nourishment.

At some point, creatures traveling through a swamp must trudge through water. When they do, they might encounter Leeches. Leeches have a way of slipping past the best defenses and latching onto the skin under a creature's armor or clothing. Not only do these parasites cause damage to the creatures they attack, they can cause a group to be hesitant to enter other bodies of water, giving opponents a chance to strike.

Leeches Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within an area containing Leeches.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Leeches are removed.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 19): The character safely removes the Leeches.

Special: Leeches ignore the effects of a creature's armor, unless the armor is natural or airtight.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on Loose Sand.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Loose Sand.

Acrobatics (DC 18): The character tumbles through the sand to reach more stable ground, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Jump (DC 23): The character attempts to leap out of the loose sand, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 13): The character notices that the sand appears loose.

Special: If the Hazard's attack is successful, the target is restricted to one Move Action per round, but the target cannot leave its square because it is unable to find secure footing. If the Hazard's attack fails, the target can leave its square.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The sand beneath your feet shifts as you move, making progress difficult.

Technically, all sand in a desert is loose, but some areas are less tightly packed than others. Creatures unfortunate enough to stand in such an area have a hard time moving out of it. Placing Loose Sand atop a dune or in the middle of a dry riverbed could put the heroes in a position where they have little or no cover against enemies that find them.

Loose Sand Statistics (CL 1)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on Loose Sand.

Attack: +3 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Loose Sand.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 18): The character tumbles through the sand to reach more stable ground, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Jump (DC 23): The character attempts to leap out of the loose sand, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 13): The character notices that the sand appears loose.

Special: If the Hazard's attack is successful, the target is restricted to one Move Action per round, but the target cannot leave its square because it is unable to find secure footing. If the Hazard's attack fails, the target can leave its square.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being enters a square in containing Low-Hanging Branches.
On Trigger
Perception (DC 14): The character detects the Low-Hanging Branches as they approach, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid them.
Special: For targets riding on a creature or in a vehicle that does not provide Total Cover, the Hazard's damage is 2d10x2.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A number of branches covered in jagged razorvine hang down in your path, making it difficult to maneuver past them safely.

Running into branches while traveling through a forest or jungle is never pleasant, especially when moving at high velocity on a Speeder Bike or a Mount. Although Low-Hanging Branches cause problems on their own- especially those covered with sharp vines- some beings find ways to use the limbs as makeshift weapons, pulling them back and releasing them as opponents run or ride past. Clever manipulators also use Low-Hanging Branches to divert their foes toward another trap planted along a path that looks more appealing.

Low-Hanging Branches Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being enters a square in containing Low-Hanging Branches.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 14): The character detects the Low-Hanging Branches as they approach, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid them.

Special: For targets riding on a creature or in a vehicle that does not provide Total Cover, the Hazard's damage is 2d10x2.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being moves into a square containing a Muddy Sinkhole.
None
Perception (DC 10): The character spots the Muddy Sinkhole.
Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target is successful, the target falls into the Muddy Sinkhole, which is 3 squares deep and leads to a pit with a thin layer of sludge at the bottom.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Dawn of Defiance (The Traitor's Gambit)

See also: Hazards

Throughout the jungle are a number of Muddy Sinkholes, created when the roots of a massive fungus rot away but leave detritus in the ground.

Muddy Sinkhole Statistics (CL 1)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being moves into a square containing a Muddy Sinkhole.

Attack: +3 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: None

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 10): The character spots the Muddy Sinkhole.

Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target is successful, the target falls into the Muddy Sinkhole, which is 3 squares deep and leads to a pit with a thin layer of sludge at the bottom.

changes.value: Hazards
A Vehicle or Starship begins its turn in an area affected by a Meteor Shower.
Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +12)

Pilot (DC 24): As a Reaction to the Meteor Shower's attack, the Pilot of a Vehicle can make a Pilot check to gain a +2 dodge bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Meteor Shower's attacks until the start of his or her next turn. Use Computer (DC 19): The character identifies the impending Meteorite Shower with sensors.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Meteor showers in the upper atmosphere of a planet can be extremely dangerous for Vehicles passing through that area, as most of the meteors have not yet been burned away by atmospheric entry.

Meteor showers consist of falling rocks, which usually burn up or explode as they plummet through the planet's atmosphere. However, rocks that reach the world's surface or strike a ship in flight can deal plenty of damage.

Meteorite Storm Statistics (CL 15)

Keywords: Area, Natural

Trigger: A Vehicle or Starship begins its turn in an area affected by a Meteor Shower.

Attack: +17 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +12)

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Pilot (DC 24): As a Reaction to the Meteor Shower's attack, the Pilot of a Vehicle can make a Pilot check to gain a +2 dodge bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Meteor Shower's attacks until the start of his or her next turn.
  • Use Computer (DC 19): The character identifies the impending Meteorite Shower with sensors.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Vehicle begins its turn within a Micrometeor Shower.
Each round at the start of the Vehicle's turn, as long as the Vehicle remains within the Micrometeor Shower.
Use Computer (DC 16): The character configures the shields to "Double Front," granting the Vehicle a +5 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

This dense area of debris is so thick with micrometeors that your deflector shields cannot repel them all.

Micrometeor Showers are fields of miniature asteroids or bits of debris resulting from damage to other Vehicles. Often, Micrometeor Showers are not detected until it is too late to avoid them. Creatures on the run can fly into a shower to deter their foes from continuing pursuit, especially if the pursuers have few or no shields. Creatures with something to hide or protect can position their stronghold where the hazard can benefit them the most.

Micrometeor Shower Statistics (CL 5)

Keywords: Artificial or Natural, Atmosphere

Trigger: A Vehicle begins its turn within a Micrometeor Shower.

Attack: +7 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the Vehicle's turn, as long as the Vehicle remains within the Micrometeor Shower.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Use Computer (DC 16): The character configures the shields to "Double Front," granting the Vehicle a +5 Equipment bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being attempts to move through the Malfunctioning Blast Door.
Special

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character dives through the opening, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Mechanics (DC 21): The character fixes the Malfunctioning Blast Door so that it no longer operates erratically. Use Computer (DC 21): The character bypasses the controls for the Malfunctioning Blast Door and forces it to remain open.
Special: Each round, the Malfunctioning Blast Door opens on a random Initiative Count and closes on another random Initiative Count; the Gamemaster makes each Initiative check for the door.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A blast door opens and closes on its own at lightning speed and at random intervals.

A malfunctioning blast door that does not stay open or closed upon request can be used in a number of ways beyond simply endangering the heroes. The door can provide Cover for those on one side or the other, allowing weapons fire to pass through only during the times in each round that the door is open. In addition, combatants can use the blast door to slow foes down while they try to get away.

Malfunctioning Blast Door Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Artificial

Trigger: A being attempts to move through the Malfunctioning Blast Door.

Attack: +6 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Special

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 26): The character dives through the opening, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Mechanics (DC 21): The character fixes the Malfunctioning Blast Door so that it no longer operates erratically.
  • Use Computer (DC 21): The character bypasses the controls for the Malfunctioning Blast Door and forces it to remain open.

Special: Each round, the Malfunctioning Blast Door opens on a random Initiative Count and closes on another random Initiative Count; the Gamemaster makes each Initiative check for the door.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A creature or Droid begins its turn in an area affected by a Meteorite Storm.
Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +10)

Acrobatics (DC 24): As a Reaction to the Meteorite Storm's attack, a character can make an Acrobatics check to gain a +2 dodge bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Meteorite Storm's attacks until the start of his or her next turn. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 19): The character identifies the impending Meteorite Storm.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Numerous meteorites descend through the planet's atmosphere. While most burn up on entry, others strike the ground in a dangerous hail of tiny, burning rocks.

Meteorite Storm Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Area, Natural

Trigger: A creature or Droid begins its turn in an area affected by a Meteorite Storm.

Attack: +12 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +10)

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 24): As a Reaction to the Meteorite Storm's attack, a character can make an Acrobatics check to gain a +2 dodge bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Meteorite Storm's attacks until the start of his or her next turn.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 19): The character identifies the impending Meteorite Storm.

changes.value: Hazards, Poisons
A creature is exposed to Null Gas.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Null Gas.
Special: After 1 minute of exposure to Null Gas, a creature is affected as if in a Vacuum and must deal with the effects of Suffocation.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

See also: Hazards, Poisons

Null Gas is a unique type of gas that neutralizes oxygen in the air.

Null Gas Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Artificial, Poison

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Null Gas.

Attack: +14 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Null Gas.

Special: After 1 minute of exposure to Null Gas, a creature is affected as if in a Vacuum and must deal with the effects of Suffocation.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship begins its turn within a Nebula.
Hourly, until the Starship leaves the Nebula.
Mechanics (DC 24): For 1 hour, the character staves off the effects of nebula dust and gases. The character can attempt another check each hour for as long as the Starship remains within the Nebula.

Special: The dust and gases from a nebula might affect a Starship's systems. If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the Starship's Fortitude Defense by 5 or more, one of its systems (Of the Gamemaster's choice) becomes unavailable and cannot be repaired until the Starship leaves the nebula.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

This stellar gas cloud will someday coalesce and become a star, but for now, it threatens to interfere with your ship's systems.

The brilliant and colorful dust and gases that make up a nebula might reduce visibility and damage ships' systems, but they are not extremely dangerous. Thus, many creatures seeking to escape from their enemies consider a nebula an excellent place to hide. If combat breaks out within a Nebula, each side can use the cloud to its advantage, trying to attack the other from a position of concealment.

Nebula Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A Starship begins its turn within a Nebula.

Attack: +4 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Hourly, until the Starship leaves the Nebula.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Mechanics (DC 24): For 1 hour, the character staves off the effects of nebula dust and gases. The character can attempt another check each hour for as long as the Starship remains within the Nebula.

Special: The dust and gases from a nebula might affect a Starship's systems. If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the Starship's Fortitude Defense by 5 or more, one of its systems (Of the Gamemaster's choice) becomes unavailable and cannot be repaired until the Starship leaves the nebula.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Obah.

system.description:

Obah is a nerve agent capable of paralyzing most Species.

Obah Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Poison

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Obah.

Attack: +8 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Obah.

changes.value: Hazards
A character enters a square occupied by an Overloaded Conduit; 2-Square Burst.
On Trigger

Special: Overloaded Conduits can be intentionally detonated by dealing sufficient damage to them. They have Reflex Defense 15, 10 Hit Points, and Damage Reduction 10. If destroyed, they detonate as described above.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Dawn of Defiance (The Gem of Alderaan)

See also: Hazards

Several power conduits have overloaded, ready to rupture and spew ionized plasma if disturbed. Overloaded Conduits can potentially cause other conduits to explode, setting off a chain reaction.

Overloaded Conduit Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Area, Artificial, Contact, Fire

Trigger: A character enters a square occupied by an Overloaded Conduit; 2-Square Burst.

Attack: +15 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Technology) (DC 15): As a Full-Round Action, a character can attempt to detect the closest hidden Overloaded Conduit within line of sight.
  • Mechanics (DC 15): As a Full-Round Action, a character can attempt to detect the closest hidden Overloaded Conduit within line of sight.
  • Mechanics (DC 20): As a Full-Round Action, a character can attempt to disarm an Overloaded Conduit. This can be attempted multiple times, but a failure by 5 or more causes the Overloaded Conduit to detonate.
  • Perception (DC 15): As a Full-Round Action, a character can attempt to detect the closest hidden Overloaded Conduit within line of sight.
  • Perception (DC 20): If not actively searching, a character can detect an Overloaded Conduit as a Reaction immediately before entering a hazard square.

Special: Overloaded Conduits can be intentionally detonated by dealing sufficient damage to them. They have Reflex Defense 15, 10 Hit Points, and Damage Reduction 10. If destroyed, they detonate as described above.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Dawn of Defiance (The Gem of Alderaan)

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship attempts to enter O'reen
Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +8) for 5 Rounds

Pilot (DC 16): As a Reaction, the Starship's Pilot can make a Pilot check to reduce the damage caused by an exploding Orbital Defense Mine. If the check is successful, the damage taken by the Starship is reduced by half (If the Starship is already taking half damage from the attack, it instead takes one-quarter damage). Use Computer (DC 16): The character can make a Use Computer check to detect the presence of the mines. Furthermore, as a Standard Action, the character can use the Use Computer skill to use the Starship's sensors to detect the mines, granting the Starship a +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against the mines' attacks.

Special: This hazard assumes that the triggering vehicle is passing through the thick net of security satellites surrounding the whole planet. You can also choose to have the orbital defense mines only cover certain squares; in such a case, the mines trigger when a vehicle enters the square of, or a square adjacent to, an orbital defense mine, and there is no recurrence.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

These nearly invisible satellites spring to life as a ship approaches, moving rapidly toward the vessel and detonating once they get close.

The people of O'reen take the defense of their world very seriously. Despite this fact, there are many strange and powerful races throughout The Unknown Regions that have technology that is unfamiliar to the O'reenians, making it difficult for them to sense threats from the outside until it is too late. As a result, the O'reenians have created a network of Orbital Defense Mines that detect, move toward, and attack any Starship approaching O'reen without proper transponder identifiers. Whenever the heroes approach O'reen for the first time, they may encounter Orbital Defense Mines.

Orbital Defense Mines Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Artificial, Energy

Trigger: A Starship attempts to enter O'reen

Attack: +10 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each Round on Initiative Count (Initiative +8) for 5 Rounds

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Pilot (DC 16): As a Reaction, the Starship's Pilot can make a Pilot check to reduce the damage caused by an exploding Orbital Defense Mine. If the check is successful, the damage taken by the Starship is reduced by half (If the Starship is already taking half damage from the attack, it instead takes one-quarter damage).
  • Use Computer (DC 16): The character can make a Use Computer check to detect the presence of the mines. Furthermore, as a Standard Action, the character can use the Use Computer skill to use the Starship's sensors to detect the mines, granting the Starship a +2 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against the mines' attacks.

Special: This hazard assumes that the triggering vehicle is passing through the thick net of security satellites surrounding the whole planet. You can also choose to have the orbital defense mines only cover certain squares; in such a case, the mines trigger when a vehicle enters the square of, or a square adjacent to, an orbital defense mine, and there is no recurrence.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within a Production Assembly Line.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Production Assembly Line.

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character twists and rolls between the mechanisms, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Mechanics (DC 31): The character sabotages the equipment as they move through it, imposing a -5 penalty to the Hazard's attacks. Use Computer (DC 31): Slicing into the controls, the character shuts down the Production Assembly Line.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target becomes Pinned on the Production Assembly Line. The Hazard gains a +5 bonus to attack rolls against the target until the target escapes being Pinned.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A massive network of machines is in full production; moving through the room would be extremely dangerous.

Creatures trying to move through a Production Assembly Line face a number of problems. The line itself, where products are assembled, usually has enough space for creatures to maneuver and possibly fight against opponents. The mechanisms that run the line provide creatures with Cover or Concealment during a firefight. In addition, the items being assembled might be weapons, tools, or other objects that combatants can use during battle.

Production Assembly Line Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Artificial

Trigger: A being begins its turn within a Production Assembly Line.

Attack: +14 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Production Assembly Line.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 26): The character twists and rolls between the mechanisms, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Mechanics (DC 31): The character sabotages the equipment as they move through it, imposing a -5 penalty to the Hazard's attacks.
  • Use Computer (DC 31): Slicing into the controls, the character shuts down the Production Assembly Line.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target becomes Pinned on the Production Assembly Line. The Hazard gains a +5 bonus to attack rolls against the target until the target escapes being Pinned.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

Special: A creature moved to the bottom of the Condition Track by Paralytic Poison is Immobilized but does not fall unconscious.

An injected Poison renders a target immobile for a short time.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

None

The toxin of the Spiner Plant can dull the senses and impede the natural processes of a living creature.

changes.value: Hazards
A character enters a square occupied by a Primed Fuel Line; 4-Square Burst.
On Trigger
Special: The Primed Fuel Line can be detonated with a well-placed attack (Reflex Defense 20, DR 5, 10 Hit Points).

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Dawn of Defiance (The Gem of Alderaan)

See also: Hazards

The fuel line has been primed to detonate if any character moves into a catwalk square beneath it. If the line detonates, Characters adjacent to the doors or on the lower level have Cover against this attack (+5 cover bonus to Reflex Defense, no damage on miss).

Primed Fuel Line Statistics (CL 13)

Keywords: Area, Artificial, Contact

Trigger: A character enters a square occupied by a Primed Fuel Line; 4-Square Burst.

Attack: +13 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Mechanics (DC 20): As a Full-Round Action, a character can disarm the Primed Fuel Line. If successful, fuel is shunted out of the main line, preventing an explosion. On a failure by 1 to 4 points, the character can try again. On a failure by 5 or more, the Primed Fuel Line detonates immediately.
  • Perception (DC 20): A character can detect a Primed Fuel Line and recognizes the danger it poses.

Special: The Primed Fuel Line can be detonated with a well-placed attack (Reflex Defense 20, DR 5, 10 Hit Points).
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Dawn of Defiance (The Gem of Alderaan)

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on Quicksand.
On Trigger

Perception (DC 23): The character detects the Quicksand before they reach it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. This bonus stacks with the bonus they receive from a successful Survival check against the Hazard. Survival (DC 23): The character determines the boundaries of the Quicksand and gains a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. This bonus stacks with the bonus they receive from a successful Perception check against the Hazard. Swim (DC 28): The character escapes from the Quicksand at the end of the round.

Special: A creature caught in Quicksand sinks into it over a period of 5 rounds. If the creature fully sinks into the Quicksand, it can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution score before it must begin making Endurance checks to Hold Breath.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A deep bog is covered with sand and other natural objects, making it virtually unnoticeable.

The hidden danger of Quicksand can be exploited by beings fighting in forests or jungles. Aside from its most obvious use as a trap, Quicksand can also be an excellent hiding place- as long as those using it can get out in a reasonable amount of time. Quicksand can also serve as an obstacle preventing heroes from obtaining a specific item or artifact. If the desired item is cast into the Quicksand, at least one of the heroes must risk his or her life to retrieve it.

Quicksand Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on Quicksand.

Attack: +10 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 23): The character detects the Quicksand before they reach it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. This bonus stacks with the bonus they receive from a successful Survival check against the Hazard.
  • Survival (DC 23): The character determines the boundaries of the Quicksand and gains a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. This bonus stacks with the bonus they receive from a successful Perception check against the Hazard.
  • Swim (DC 28): The character escapes from the Quicksand at the end of the round.

Special: A creature caught in Quicksand sinks into it over a period of 5 rounds. If the creature fully sinks into the Quicksand, it can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution score before it must begin making Endurance checks to Hold Breath.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Rocky Ground.

Jump (DC 14): The character leaps over the rubble, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Stealth (DC 19): Using the same technique used for moving silently, the character slows his or her movement to half speed to avoid taking damage.

Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target succeeds, the target falls Prone. If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target falls Prone and also moves backward 1 square.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Small stones and rubble litter the floor, making it difficult to keep your balance and to move quickly.

Rocky Ground is common in caves and probably will be present in any subterranean encounter. To increase the peril of this Hazard and add more excitement, use rocky ground near cliffs, pits, and other features that create the possibility of a dangerous fall. An epic Lightsaber duel on rocky ground atop a cliff overlooking a lava flow might be a memorable battle. Likewise, Rocky Ground can add an extra element of danger to combat that takes place around a Sinkhole.

Rocky Ground Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on Rocky Ground.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Rocky Ground.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 14): The character leaps over the rubble, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Stealth (DC 19): Using the same technique used for moving silently, the character slows his or her movement to half speed to avoid taking damage.

Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target succeeds, the target falls Prone. If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the target falls Prone and also moves backward 1 square.

changes.value: Hazards
A torrent of water begins pouring into the cavern; targeting every being in the area.
Every minute once the water level is at least 1 square deep, until the being escapes the Rising Water.

Endurance (DC 19): The character resists the urge to breathe when submerged and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 24): The character spots an opening through which air is escaping, which indicates a way out of the cavern. Swim (DC 14): The character moves through the water, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.
Special: The water level rises at a rate of 1 square per minute (10 rounds) until the cavern is filled with water. Creatures within the filled cavern must hold their breath or begin drowning.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The water level in the cavern is rising fast. You need to find a way out.

This Hazard makes for a good test of wits, especially if the heroes are trapped in a cave (Whether by accident or by their opponents' design) with no apparent way out. Although the situation seems to grow more dire as the water rises, clever heroes will realize that the air must be going somewhere. This Hazard can also be used to endanger other creatures that need to be rescued by the heroes. In addition, setting a battle in a cavern that is filling rapidly with water adds both a sense of urgency and a cinematic element to the combat.

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A torrent of water begins pouring into the cavern; targeting every being in the area.

Attack: +5 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Every minute once the water level is at least 1 square deep, until the being escapes the Rising Water.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 19): The character resists the urge to breathe when submerged and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 24): The character spots an opening through which air is escaping, which indicates a way out of the cavern.
  • Swim (DC 14): The character moves through the water, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.

Special: The water level rises at a rate of 1 square per minute (10 rounds) until the cavern is filled with water. Creatures within the filled cavern must hold their breath or begin drowning.

A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the area of the Rock Slide.

Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 23): The character determines from the surroundings that the area might be unstable. A minor seismic quake, a shot from a blaster bolt, or an explosive could cause a Rock Slide. Survival (DC 28): After observing the area, the character finds a few places where he or she could take cover during a Rock Slide, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A large mass of rocks and boulders tumbles down the mountainside toward you.

Rock Slides can be particularly dangerous to a group of heroes. Their enemies can start a Rock Slide intentionally and perhaps even direct its path by placing artificial structures to funnel the rocks or by using The Force to move boulders onto a desired course. In addition, you can use a Rock Slide to steer heroes in a particular direction.

Rock Slide Statistics (CL 9)

Keywords: Artificial or Natural

Trigger: A loud noise occurs within the area of the Hazard; targeting every being and object in the area.

Attack: +11 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the area of the Rock Slide.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 23): The character determines from the surroundings that the area might be unstable. A minor seismic quake, a shot from a blaster bolt, or an explosive could cause a Rock Slide.
  • Survival (DC 28): After observing the area, the character finds a few places where he or she could take cover during a Rock Slide, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship enters a square within the Rampaging Purrgil.
Each round, on Initiative Count 10

Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character uses the ship's communication systems to imitate Purrgil calls. This confuses the Purrgil and delays the hazard by 1d4 rounds. Stealth (DC 26): The character identifies a nearby gas cloud and attempts evade the beast, granting a +5 cover bonus to Reflex Defense against the Rampaging Purrgil. Pilot (DC 35): With quick thinking and fast flying, the Pilot can weave around the Purrgil, granting a +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against this hazard,

Special: After a Starship is hit and damaged by this Hazard, the Purrgil will attempt to crush its prey with its strong tentacles and jaw the following round: (+15 vs Fortitude Defense; 2d10x2, -1 Persistent step on the Condition Track, can only be removed with Repairs).

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Rampaging Purrgil Hazard data created by The Dark Times Podcast hosts sampainoticeme and ZenithSloth.

See also: Hazards

Purrgil are a semi-sentient deep space species of whale-like creatures with several strong tentacles. They vary in size from that of small starfighters or freighter but several specimens are known to rival Star Destroyers. They feed on energy-dense gases and are capable of traveling through Hyperspace. Considered a dangerous pest by many spacers, these giants played a mythological role in inspiring the first Hyperspace explorers to seek their fortune across the stars.

This Hazard represents a particularly imposing and irritated Purrgil. Small arms typical of Starfighters and Space Transports will do little to deter it, but armaments found aboard Capital Ships may prove effective.

Rampaging Purrgil Statistics (CL 13)

Keywords: Area, Contact, Natural

Trigger: A Starship enters a square within the Rampaging Purrgil.

Attack: +15 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round, on Initiative Count 10

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character uses the ship's communication systems to imitate Purrgil calls. This confuses the Purrgil and delays the hazard by 1d4 rounds.
  • Stealth (DC 26): The character identifies a nearby gas cloud and attempts evade the beast, granting a +5 cover bonus to Reflex Defense against the Rampaging Purrgil.
  • Pilot (DC 35): With quick thinking and fast flying, the Pilot can weave around the Purrgil, granting a +5 dodge bonus to Reflex Defense against this hazard,

Special: After a Starship is hit and damaged by this Hazard, the Purrgil will attempt to crush its prey with its strong tentacles and jaw the following round: (+15 vs Fortitude Defense; 2d10x2, -1 Persistent step on the Condition Track, can only be removed with Repairs).

Purrgil leave easily detectable trails through Hyperspace, which can aid in navigation. Astrogation along this trail takes half the normal time, but this trail leads to an unknown or obscure destination.
