changes.value: Hazards
A creature or Droid begins its turn in the Stampede.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is in the Stampede.

Acrobatics (DC 22): The character nimble dodges from the coming beasts, gaining a +2 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede. Jump (DC 27): The character reactively leaps away from oncoming impacts, gaining a +3 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede. Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 27): The character predicts the direction in which various elements within the stampede will move, gaining a +3 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede. Persuasion (DC 30): The character indicates to the stampede to clear a path for the character and his or her allies, reducing the skill DCs of the Stampede by 2 for their allies. Ride (DC 30): The character uses their experience to guide the stampede in a predictable manner, reducing the skill DCs of the Stampede by 5 for their allies.
Special: If an attack by the Stampede exceeds a target's Reflex Defense by more than 5 points, the character immediatly falls Prone (and subsequent attacks by the Stampede gain a +5 bonus).

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Stampede Hazard data created by Wikia user Chellewalker (formally Wikia user Lukewarner) (Community Showcase 05-22).

See also: Hazards

A herd of normally docile Beasts have been driven to panic, and their wild charge away from danger has them surging straight towards you.

Stampede Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Area, Natural

Trigger: A creature or Droid begins its turn in the Stampede.

Attack: +9 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is in the Stampede.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 22): The character nimble dodges from the coming beasts, gaining a +2 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede.
  • Jump (DC 27): The character reactively leaps away from oncoming impacts, gaining a +3 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede.
  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 27): The character predicts the direction in which various elements within the stampede will move, gaining a +3 bonus to their Reflex Defense against the Stampede.
  • Persuasion (DC 30): The character indicates to the stampede to clear a path for the character and his or her allies, reducing the skill DCs of the Stampede by 2 for their allies.
  • Ride (DC 30): The character uses their experience to guide the stampede in a predictable manner, reducing the skill DCs of the Stampede by 5 for their allies.

Special: If an attack by the Stampede exceeds a target's Reflex Defense by more than 5 points, the character immediatly falls Prone (and subsequent attacks by the Stampede gain a +5 bonus).

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on a Sandstone Pillar.
Each time that the target reaches a new Sandstone Pillar.

Acrobatics (DC 27): The character works to keep their balance while moving from pillar to pillar, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Jump (DC 27): As the character leaps to the next pillar, they aim for the center to avoid destabilizing it. By doing so, the character gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 22): The character spots a possible weakness in the pillar ahead and avoids it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
Special: A line of 1d4+2 Sandstone Pillars creates a path to the other side of the ravine.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Naturally carved stone pillars are the only way to cross the spon of the canyon. They don't look very stable.

To reach the other side of a canyon, the heroes must move across a series of tall Sandstone Pillars. The top surfaces of the pillars are mostly flat, but wind erosion has thinned the stone to the point that the towers are unstable. The heroes discover this when a pillar shifts slightly when a hero lands on it, which might cause the hero to lose his or her balance and fall to the canyon floor below. If enemies are in pursuit, the heroes might leap hastily from pillar to pillar in an attempt to cross the canyon quickly, putting their lives in even more peril.

Sandstone Pillars Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on a Sandstone Pillar.

Attack: +8 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each time that the target reaches a new Sandstone Pillar.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 27): The character works to keep their balance while moving from pillar to pillar, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Jump (DC 27): As the character leaps to the next pillar, they aim for the center to avoid destabilizing it. By doing so, the character gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 22): The character spots a possible weakness in the pillar ahead and avoids it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: A line of 1d4+2 Sandstone Pillars creates a path to the other side of the ravine.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

A being touches a Spiner Plant.
On Trigger

Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 18): The character identifies the Spiner Plant. Perception (DC 23): The character spots the Spiner Plant before it attacks, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Stealth (DC 28): The character harvests the Spiner Plant without setting off its defense mechanism, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
Special: The thorns of the Spiner Plant deliver a Plant Toxin.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A rare and beautiful flowering plant has a deadly secret.

The Spiner Plant, which grows only in moist, humid climates such as swamps, has a Plant Toxin that can be processed to create a serum that treats a wide variety of Diseases and Poisons. However, harvesting the Plant Toxin safely is a difficult task, because the plant shoots deadly thorns at creatures that brush against it. But an entire adventure could revolve around procuring a Spiner Plant to help in treating a deadly disease.

Spiner Plant Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Contact, Natural, Poison

Trigger: A being touches a Spiner Plant.

Attack: +10 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 18): The character identifies the Spiner Plant.
  • Perception (DC 23): The character spots the Spiner Plant before it attacks, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Stealth (DC 28): The character harvests the Spiner Plant without setting off its defense mechanism, gaining a +5 bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

Special: The thorns of the Spiner Plant deliver a Plant Toxin.

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within Speeder Traffic.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within Speeder Traffic.

Acrobatics (DC 23): The character weaves and tumbles through the Speeder Traffic, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Jump (DC 23): The character jumps out of the way of an oncoming speeder or makes an effort to leap from one speeder to another, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 18): The character watches carefully for oncoming speeders, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Dozens of speeders zip by as you attempt to cross to the other side of the thoroughfare.

The last thing that speeder pilots want to see in their path is a bunch of creatures in the middle of a fight. Nevertheless, combatants who find themselves in speeder lanes can use the vehicles in a variety of ways. If combatants put the speeders between themselves and their opponents, the vehicles can provide Cover or prevent their foes from reaching them. If the combatants join the traffic to continue their battle between or atop the vehicles, they can use the speeders as island platforms from which to launch their assaults.

Speeder Traffic Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Artificial

Trigger: A being begins its turn within Speeder Traffic.

Attack: +10 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within Speeder Traffic.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 23): The character weaves and tumbles through the Speeder Traffic, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Jump (DC 23): The character jumps out of the way of an oncoming speeder or makes an effort to leap from one speeder to another, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 18): The character watches carefully for oncoming speeders, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.

A being begins its turn within Strangle Vines.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Strangle Vines.

Endurance (DC 27): If the character is being choked by the Strangle Vines, for 1 round they take only half damage and do not move on the Condition Track. Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 22): The character identifies the Strangle Vines. As a result, the character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Strangle Vines.
Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the Strangle Vines wrap around the target's neck and begin choking the victim.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A mass of vines hangs down from the trees, creating a curtain of vegetation that can choke an unwary creature.

Strangle Vines wrap themselves around an unsuspecting victim and often choke the creature to death. Galactic scholars of botany and life sciences cannot agree about why the vines behave in this manner. Strangle Vines inadvertently guard valuable items left behind by their victims, waiting to entrap any creatures that come along later to retrieve the objects.

Strangle Vines Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within Strangle Vines.

Attack: +8 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Strangle Vines.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 27): If the character is being choked by the Strangle Vines, for 1 round they take only half damage and do not move on the Condition Track.
  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 22): The character identifies the Strangle Vines. As a result, the character and their allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Strangle Vines.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the Strangle Vines wrap around the target's neck and begin choking the victim.

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship begins its turn exposed to Solar Wind.
Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains exposed to the Solar Wind.

Perception (DC 17): The character detects the solar flare and predicts the imminent Solar Wind. Use Computer (DC 22): The character configures the Starship's shields to better protect it from the Hazard, granting a +5 Equipment bonus to the Starship's Fortitude Defense against the Solar Wind.
Special: Each creature inside the Starship takes half damage from Radiation if the Hazard's attack is successful and takes no damage on a miss.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A large emission of charged particles from a nearby star, probably the result of a solar flare, poses a risk of radiation.

A star releases its Solar Wind as a mostly steady flow of ions that can cause damage to a Starship's systems, much like an Ion Cannon. Anyone who detects the eruption of a solar flare during combat can use the incident, if they act quickly enough, to lure opponents into the Solar Wind and hope that the ion burst is enough to knock out the enemy ship's systems for a while. In addition, a Solar Wind can give away the presence of a cloaked vessel when the ions cascade against the cloaking field and reveal the ship.

Solar Wind Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Energy, Natural

Trigger: A Starship begins its turn exposed to Solar Wind.

Attack: +9 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains exposed to the Solar Wind.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Perception (DC 17): The character detects the solar flare and predicts the imminent Solar Wind.
  • Use Computer (DC 22): The character configures the Starship's shields to better protect it from the Hazard, granting a +5 Equipment bonus to the Starship's Fortitude Defense against the Solar Wind.

Special: Each creature inside the Starship takes half damage from Radiation if the Hazard's attack is successful and takes no damage on a miss.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

system.description:

Smoke obscures creatures' vision, causes them to choke, and burns their eyes.

Smoke Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in Smoke.

Attack: +4 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Smoke.

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn in a square occupied by a Sarlacc Pit.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is within the area occupied by the Sarlacc Pit.

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character avoids the Sarlacc's tentacles, but they still take damage from the attack. Climb (DC 31): The character manages to climb 1 square closer to the edge of the pit. Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Sarlacc Pit before they reach it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the Sarlacc grabs the target and pulls it to the bottom of the pit at a rate of 2 squares per round. If the target reaches the bottom of the pit, it is ingested.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

In this pit, a Sarlacc waits to capture and ingest prey.

Whether a creature is standing at the edge of the large pit or on a plank extended from a skiff floating over it, looking into a Sarlacc Pit is enough to incite fear. For most heroes, stumbling across a Sarlacc is enough of an encounter in itself as they struggle to climb out of the pit and away from the hungry maw of the creature. They could also chase enemies into the pit (Or be chased into it themselves), or they could find a victim that needs to be saved from being digested over a period of a thousand years. Alternatively, the heroes could be captured by their enemies (As in Return of the Jedi) and must escape being fed to the Sarlacc.

Sarlacc Pit Statistics (CL 12)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn in a square occupied by a Sarlacc Pit.

Attack: +14 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target is within the area occupied by the Sarlacc Pit.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 26): The character avoids the Sarlacc's tentacles, but they still take damage from the attack.
  • Climb (DC 31): The character manages to climb 1 square closer to the edge of the pit.
  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Sarlacc Pit before they reach it, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard's attacks.

Special: If the Hazard's attack roll exceeds the target's Reflex Defense by 5 or more, the Sarlacc grabs the target and pulls it to the bottom of the pit at a rate of 2 squares per round. If the target reaches the bottom of the pit, it is ingested.

Special: Creatures hit and damaged by this Hazard are Grabbed by a tentacle and can attempt to escape as normal. Any creature that is both Grabbed and either reduced to 0 Hit Points or rendered unconscious is consumed by the Sea Monster.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

The long, undulating tentacles of a sea creature reach out to grab you, threatening to crush you and drag you down beneath the surface of the Alkaline Sea.

Sea Monster Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Contact, Natural

Trigger: A being enters a square within reach of a Sea Monster.

Attack: +12 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round, on Initiative Count (Initiative +11)

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 19): The character identifies the telltale signs of a sea predator nearby and can tell that the area is hazardous.

Special: Creatures hit and damaged by this Hazard are Grabbed by a tentacle and can attempt to escape as normal. Any creature that is both Grabbed and either reduced to 0 Hit Points or rendered unconscious is consumed by the Sea Monster.

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn in the Sandstorm.
Hourly, until the being leaves the Sandstorm.

Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 21): The character determines that the incoming cloud is a violent Sandstorm, and all members of the group gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 16): The character detects the Sandstorm before it reaches them.
Special: A Sandstorm grants Concealment to beings and objects within it. Any target wearing a sealed protective suit is not affected by this Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The sand whips past you at blinding speed, eroding any exposed objects or flesh.

Creatures caught in the middle of a Sandstorm face a number of problems. Aside from the large volume of sand blowing across open surfaces and bare flesh at high speeds, the storm hinders vision. Enemies several meters away who could be seen clearly under normal conditions can barely be seen during a Sandstorm, if at all. A Sandstorm can be a challenging place for combat- or it can present a chance for creatures to make their escape from foes.

Sandstorm Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Area, Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn in the Sandstorm.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Hourly, until the being leaves the Sandstorm.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 21): The character determines that the incoming cloud is a violent Sandstorm, and all members of the group gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 16): The character detects the Sandstorm before it reaches them.

Special: A Sandstorm grants Concealment to beings and objects within it. Any target wearing a sealed protective suit is not affected by this Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A creature reads an ancient Sith tome, scroll, or tablet.
None.
Treat Injury (DC 25): The character treats The Madness of Knowledge along with 8 hours of rest (Cannot be performed by the victim).

Special: The character is filled with paranoia and creeping insanity until treated, and any time the character rolls a Natural 1 on an attack roll, their next attack roll made before the end of the encounter must be against an ally, not an enemy.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Hazards

Before Holocron technology was developed, and sometimes even after, the Sith recorded much of their dark knowledge in traditional forms. Locked away in the mausoleums dedicated to ancient Sith Lords are thousands of scrolls, tomes, and tablets bearing instructions on how to master a variety of Sith techniques. Like Sith Holocrons, these ancient writings describe the methods of using lost [Dark Side] Force Powers, the construction of Sith Weapons and Sith Artifacts, information on Sith Alchemy, and treaties on the domination and destruction of others.

Sith scrolls, tomes, and tablets function in much the same way as a Holocron for the purposes of learning new Force Powers and Force Talents. However, these writing have neither a Jedi Master Holocron Gatekeeper nor a Sith Lord Holocron Gatekeeper, and as such their knowledge is open to anyone who can master them, given time. Searchers should beware; many Sith writings are imbued with the madness of their creators, and the knowledge they contain has been known to drive the unprepared student to insanity.

The Madness of Knowledge Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: N/A

Trigger: A creature reads an ancient Sith tome, scroll, or tablet.

Attack: +8 vs Will Defense

Recurrence: None.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 25): The character treats The Madness of Knowledge along with 8 hours of rest (Cannot be performed by the victim).

Special: The character is filled with paranoia and creeping insanity until treated, and any time the character rolls a Natural 1 on an attack roll, their next attack roll made before the end of the encounter must be against an ally, not an enemy.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn on Sucking Mud.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Sucking Mud.

Jump (DC 13): The character leaps over the patch of mud, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 13): The character spots the Sucking Mud, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Survival (DC 18): The character knows a technique to escape from the Sucking Mud more easily, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to a Strength check to free themselves from the mud.

Special: If the Hazard successfully attacks a creature, the target becomes stuck in the Sucking Mud and cannot move from their current square until they succeed on a DC 15 Strength check to free themselves.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

The patch of ground ahead looks different from the turf you have seen before now, and the small skeletons visible in the dirt unsettle you.

Soil can be composed of many different substances, and some dirt thickens when it turns to mud. These patches of Sucking Mud grab and hold any creature that tries to move through them. Combatants who know the location of a patch of Sucking Mud can use it to lure their enemies into a trap. Melee combat between two opponents stuck in Sucking Mud becomes interesting, especially if both are trapped some distance from one another.

Sucking Mud Statistics (CL 1)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn on Sucking Mud.

Attack: +3 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains on the Sucking Mud.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 13): The character leaps over the patch of mud, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 13): The character spots the Sucking Mud, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Survival (DC 18): The character knows a technique to escape from the Sucking Mud more easily, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to a Strength check to free themselves from the mud.

Special: If the Hazard successfully attacks a creature, the target becomes stuck in the Sucking Mud and cannot move from their current square until they succeed on a DC 15 Strength check to free themselves.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A Starship begins its turn within a Space Minefield.
Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Space Minefield.
Pilot (DC 32): The character dodges the mines as they pass through the field, granting the ship a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard for the round.
Special: One square of space can contain up to 1d6+3 space mines, but only one attack occurs per ship per square.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Space mines litter the area around your ship.

Many pilots consider negotiating a Space Minefield to be attempting suicide, but entering such a dangerous area can pay off. After all, somebody took the time to plant dozens of mines, perhaps to protect something valuable in the area. Any Starships seeking to cross the Space Minefield can blast one mine at a time to open a path or can fly through and trust their pilots' skills. Combatants in a minefield can use a Tractor Beam to pull mines out of the way or to propel them at an enemy ship.

Space Minefield Statistics (CL 15)

Keywords: Artificial, Energy

Trigger: A Starship begins its turn within a Space Minefield.

Attack: +17 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the Starship's turn, as long as the Starship remains within the Space Minefield.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Pilot (DC 32): The character dodges the mines as they pass through the field, granting the ship a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard for the round.

Special: One square of space can contain up to 1d6+3 space mines, but only one attack occurs per ship per square.

changes.value: Hazards
A spark or energy source comes into contact with Swamp Gas; targeting every being and object within a 2x2-square area.
On Trigger

Acrobatics (DC 21): The character rolls away from the Swamp Gas as it ignites, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 16): The character recognizes the presence of Swamp Gas.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A near-transparent cloud of gas is exuded by decomposing matter in a swamp.

Virtually undetectable to the naked eye, Swamp Gas can be troublesome when it drifts into an occupied area, especially around creatures that are capable of making a fire. Combatants who detect the presence of the gas during combat often try to use it to their advantage, such as by firing a blaster bolt through the gas when it is near an opponent or setting off a grenade near the gas to boost the destructive power of the explosion. Clever creatures might capture Swamp Gas in a breakable container and use it as a grenade.

Swamp Gas Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Area, Atmosphere, Fire, Natural

Trigger: A spark or energy source comes into contact with Swamp Gas; targeting every being and object within a 2x2-square area.

Attack: +6 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: On Trigger

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 21): The character rolls away from the Swamp Gas as it ignites, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Knowledge (Physical Sciences) (DC 16): The character recognizes the presence of Swamp Gas.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being ends its turn on a Sinkhole.
None

Acrobatics (DC 26): The character twists to grab the edge of the hole, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid falling in. Climb (DC 26): As the character falls into the hole, they grab the wall and slow their descent, reducing the amount of damage the character takes by half. Jump (DC 21): By jumping across the opening of the hole, the character gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid falling in.
Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target is successful, the target falls into the hole and takes Falling Damage when it hits the bottom.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

In your path is a large, gaping hole in the ground.

The Sinkhole is a common Hazard. The difference between a Pit and a Sinkhole is that a pit has no additional exit, whereas a Sinkhole leads to an underground passage. Despite its apparent simplicity, this Hazard can be used in many ways: a covered pit that spans a path, a deep sinkhole, a pit with spikes or other sharp objects lining the bottom, a pit with a predator at the bottom, and so on. Combatants separated by a hole can fight from different sides, or one group could attempt to force the other toward the edge.

Sinkhole Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being ends its turn on a Sinkhole.

Attack: +6 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: None

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 26): The character twists to grab the edge of the hole, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid falling in.
  • Climb (DC 26): As the character falls into the hole, they grab the wall and slow their descent, reducing the amount of damage the character takes by half.
  • Jump (DC 21): By jumping across the opening of the hole, the character gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid falling in.

Special: If the Hazard's attack against the target is successful, the target falls into the hole and takes Falling Damage when it hits the bottom.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Stagnant Air.

system.description:
This Homebrew Content has not been reviewed in a meaningful manner. If you wish to review this content yourself, then see Untested for more details.

Stagnant Air hazard data created by Wikia user 109.62.240.80 (A Forum User).

See also: Hazards

For some reason, this air is uncomfortably hard to breathe: either it has less (or excessively much) oxygen than normal, has bigger or smaller pressure than normal, or was being there for a long time without change.

Stagnant Air (CL 1)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in Stagnant Air.

Attack: +2 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Stagnant Air.

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within Thornbushes.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Thornbushes.

Jump (DC 19): The character jumps over the Thornbushes, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard. Perception (DC 14): The character locates a part of the Thornbushes that is less densely packed with thorns, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Stealth (DC 19): The character minimizes their contact with the thorns while moving through the bushes. As the character moves, their speed is reduced by half and the character takes half damage from a successful attack by the Thornbushes (and no damage from a miss).
Special: This Hazard can be avoided by cutting through the Thornbushes with an edged tool, a melee weapon, or a Lightsaber.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A large patch of sharp Thornbushes blocks your path.

An individual Thornbush is not very threatening, but an entire field of Thornbushes can give even the hardiest soldier pause. A large patch could be used in a variety of ways. For example, the middle of the thorns could be the home for a pack of wild beasts that attack any creatures that disturb them. Thornbushes could cover a minefield that has been seeded with explosives by the heroes' enemies. Thornbushes can also provide Concealment for anyone hiding in the thicket.

Thornbushes Statistics (CL 2)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within Thornbushes.

Attack: +4 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the being escapes the Thornbushes.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Jump (DC 19): The character jumps over the Thornbushes, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense to avoid the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 14): The character locates a part of the Thornbushes that is less densely packed with thorns, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Stealth (DC 19): The character minimizes their contact with the thorns while moving through the bushes. As the character moves, their speed is reduced by half and the character takes half damage from a successful attack by the Thornbushes (and no damage from a miss).

Special: This Hazard can be avoided by cutting through the Thornbushes with an edged tool, a melee weapon, or a Lightsaber.

system.description:

A Toxic Atmosphere is filled with chemicals that harm most creatures.

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in a Toxic Atmosphere.

Attack: +5 vs Fortitude Defense

A creature consumes food or water scavenged from the surface of Durace without first purifying it.
Hourly, until the Tainted Supplies are treated.
Survival (DC 16): The character recognizes that the supplies are tainted. Treat Injury (DC 21): The character treats the effects of the Tainted Supplies.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Chemicals from the surface and atmosphere of Durace pollute any food or water scavenged from the planet's surface.

Getting stranded on Durace is not a hopeful experience. There is little in the way of supplies available to be scavenged from the surface of the planet, and that which is available is often toxic. Any time a character consumes food or water scavenged from the surface of Durace without properly filtering and sterilizing those supplies, use the following Hazard to represent the supplies' toxic effects.

Tainted Supplies Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Ingested, Natural, Poison

Trigger: A creature consumes food or water scavenged from the surface of Durace without first purifying it.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Hourly, until the Tainted Supplies are treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Survival (DC 16): The character recognizes that the supplies are tainted.
  • Treat Injury (DC 21): The character treats the effects of the Tainted Supplies.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

A creature is exposed to Trauger.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Trauger.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

See also: Hazards, Poisons

Trauger is a volcanic toxin created by underground pressure vents on Socorro. Exposure to trauger results in horrific effects; nausea, vertigo, respiratory failure, convulsions, muscle impairment, blurred vision, or even cardiac arrest could occur.

Trauger Statistics (CL 14)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Natural, Poison

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Trauger.

Attack: +16 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains exposed to Trauger.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy at War

changes.value: Hazards, Poisons
A creature is exposed to Trihexalon.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Trihexalon is treated.
Treat Injury (DC 30; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Trihexalon.

Special: Because Trihexalon causes disintegration of biological matter, a creature that takes full damage from Trihexalon loses any limb in contact with the Poison (roll randomly if the contact is not otherwise determined).

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Galaxy of Intrigue

See also: Hazards, Poisons

Also known as Dragon's Breath or Hex, this potent biological agent comes in a powder form and causes massive breakdown in organic material.

Trihexalon Statistics (CL 15)

Keywords: Contact, Inhaled, Poison

Trigger: A creature is exposed to Trihexalon.

Attack: +20 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the Trihexalon is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 30; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Trihexalon.

Special: Because Trihexalon causes disintegration of biological matter, a creature that takes full damage from Trihexalon loses any limb in contact with the Poison (roll randomly if the contact is not otherwise determined).

A creature, Droid, or object begins its turn inside a Trash Compactor that has closed completely.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Trash Compactor.
Special: A Trash Compactor takes 10 rounds to close, remains closed for 5 rounds, and takes 10 rounds to open fully once more.

system.description:
See also: Hazards

The powerful walls of the Trash Compactor crush anything trapped inside.

Trash Compactor Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Artificial, Crushing

Trigger: A creature, Droid, or object begins its turn inside a Trash Compactor that has closed completely.

Attack: Automatic Success

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Trash Compactor.

Special: A Trash Compactor takes 10 rounds to close, remains closed for 5 rounds, and takes 10 rounds to open fully once more.

changes.value: Hazards
A creature begins its turn in an Undertow.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the creature leaves the Undertow.
Swim (DC 16): The character can make a Swim check as a Reaction to keep from being affected by the Undertow.
Special: A creature that is pulled underwater by an Undertow begins to drown. See the Endurance skill for information on holding your breath as well as on the effects of drowning.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Underwater currents can suck swimmers down into the depths, keeping them there until it is too late.

Undertow Statistics (CL 4)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in an Undertow.

Attack: +6 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the creature leaves the Undertow.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Swim (DC 16): The character can make a Swim check as a Reaction to keep from being affected by the Undertow.

Special: A creature that is pulled underwater by an Undertow begins to drown. See the Endurance skill for information on holding your breath as well as on the effects of drowning.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards
A being begins its turn within Underground Rapids.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Underground Rapids.

Acrobatics (DC 27): The character tumbles across the rocks to avoid the water, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Underground Rapids. Jump (DC 27): The character leaps from rock to rock to avoid the water, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard. Perception (DC 22): The character determines which rocks are least affected by the rushing water and offer the most stable footing, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

A torrent of water rushes through a narrow cavern. A series of wet rocks is your only path across the rapids.

Water can flow underground just as forcefully as it does on the surface, carving its own path through rock and soil alike. As creatures travel through subterranean tunnels, they might find or follow an underground waterway, perhaps as a means of reaching a particular destination or as a way of avoiding enemies in pursuit. As happens in rivers on the surface, a series of rocks resisting the flow could serve as either an obstacle to the heroes' progress or as a footbridge allowing them to cross the rapids. In either case, dealing with the rapids is a risky venture, since heroes who fall into the water can be slammed into the rocks.

Underground Rapids Statistics (CL 7)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being begins its turn within Underground Rapids.

Attack: +9 vs Reflex Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains within the Underground Rapids.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Acrobatics (DC 27): The character tumbles across the rocks to avoid the water, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Underground Rapids.
  • Jump (DC 27): The character leaps from rock to rock to avoid the water, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
  • Perception (DC 22): The character determines which rocks are least affected by the rushing water and offer the most stable footing, gaining a +5 circumstance bonus to Reflex Defense against the Hazard.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards, Diseases
A creature is damaged by a Vongspawn's Unarmed attack.
If successful, every five minutes, until Vongspawn fails an attack roll.
Treat Injury (DC 40; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Vongspawn. Force Points cannot be spent to increase the check result.

Special: If Vongspawn pushes the target to the bottom of the Condition Track, the target dies instead of falling unconscious. As this is a Yuuzhan Vong Disease, Force Points cannot be used to prevent Death. However, a Destiny Point can be spent to turn a successful attack by Vongspawn into a miss, thereby stopping the advancement of the Disease.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

See also: Hazards, Diseases

Keywords: Contact, Disease

Challenge Level: 6

Yongspawn are beings that have been infected and mutated by sabotaged Yuuzhan Vong Coral Seeds. Most Vongspawn become outcasts, left to struggle with the painful and violent Disease on their own. Naturally, they often become violent or desperate in their search for a cure. The highest concentration of these unfortunate beings is thought to be in the lower levels of Coruscant.

Vongspawn Coral Seeds

The term "Vongspawn" started as a curse word, but after the Yuuzhan Vong Invasion it became a derisive term referring to those unfortunate individuals infected by the Sith-sabotaged Yuuzhan Vong Coral Seeds. Dormant sabotaged seeds must be activated by a Sith using The Dark Side of The Force. Active Coral Seeds can infect any Species, causing painful spikes to grow from the victim's skin. Other mutations have been documented as well. The Disease is nigh incurable, though it is possible that the Yuuzhan Vong will develop a cure someday. Even The Force provides little help. Those with the Disease are exiled from their communities out of fear of transmitting the symptoms and mutations to others.

 Vongspawn Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Contact, Disease

Trigger: A creature is damaged by a Vongspawn's Unarmed attack.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: If successful, every five minutes, until Vongspawn fails an attack roll.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 40; Requires Medical Kit): The character treats the Vongspawn. Force Points cannot be spent to increase the check result.

Special: If Vongspawn pushes the target to the bottom of the Condition Track, the target dies instead of falling unconscious. As this is a Yuuzhan Vong Disease, Force Points cannot be used to prevent Death. However, a Destiny Point can be spent to turn a successful attack by Vongspawn into a miss, thereby stopping the advancement of the Disease.

A character or creature that survives the Disease becomes a Vongspawn, applying the below Vongspawn Template.

Vongspawn Template

The following rules apply to any character or creature that becomes a Vongspawn:

  • The Persistent Condition of the Disease cannot be removed until the Disease is cured.
  • Spiky growths appear on the Vongspawn's body. The Vongspawn is unable to wear normal Armor until cured.
  • When a Vongspawn hits a target with an Unarmed attack, the Vongspawn makes a secondary attack (1d20+10) against the target's Fortitude Defense. If the attack hits, the target becomes infected with the Disease.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Legacy Era Campaign Guide

changes.value: Hazards
A creature begins its turn in a Vacuum.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Vacuum.

Endurance (DC 10): The character holds his or her breath for 1 round, reducing the Vacuum's attack roll by 10. Each round the character holds his or her breath in this manner, the check DC increases by 2.

Special: A Vacuum succeeds automatically against an unconscious target, dealing cumulative d6 damage (1d6 the first round, 2d6 the second, 3d6 the third, and so on). If an unconscious target takes damage equal to or exceeding their Damage Threshold, they die. Additionally, a creature cannot move back up the Condition Track until it is returned to a breathable atmosphere.

system.description:
See also: Hazards

The vacuum of space holds no air and diffuses heat, freezing anything exposed to it.

Vacuum Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Atmosphere, Contact, Natural

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in a Vacuum.

Attack: +20 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, as long as the target remains in the Vacuum.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Endurance (DC 10): The character holds his or her breath for 1 round, reducing the Vacuum's attack roll by 10. Each round the character holds his or her breath in this manner, the check DC increases by 2.

Special: A Vacuum succeeds automatically against an unconscious target, dealing cumulative d6 damage (1d6 the first round, 2d6 the second, 3d6 the third, and so on). If an unconscious target takes damage equal to or exceeding their Damage Threshold, they die. Additionally, a creature cannot move back up the Condition Track until it is returned to a breathable atmosphere.

changes.value: Hazards
A being or vessel begins its turn in the Whirlpool.
Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the creature leaves the Whirlpool.

Pilot (DC 18): The Pilot of an aquatic vehicle caught in a Whirlpool can make a Pilot check as a Reaction to avoid the Whirlpool. Swim (DC 18): The character can make a Swim check as a Reaction to avoid the effects of the Whirlpool.

Special: Each square within the area of the Whirlpool is considered Difficult Terrain. When placing this Hazard, the GM should choose the direction in which the water in the area of the Whirlpool is moving. This is the direction in which targets affected by the Hazard are moved.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

See also: Hazards

Tidal forces stir up a dangerous Whirlpool, whipping anything caught in the Whirlpool around and threatening to tear it apart.

Whirlpool Statistics (CL 8)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A being or vessel begins its turn in the Whirlpool.

Attack: +10 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Each round at the start of the target's turn, until the creature leaves the Whirlpool.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Pilot (DC 18): The Pilot of an aquatic vehicle caught in a Whirlpool can make a Pilot check as a Reaction to avoid the Whirlpool.
  • Swim (DC 18): The character can make a Swim check as a Reaction to avoid the effects of the Whirlpool.

Special: Each square within the area of the Whirlpool is considered Difficult Terrain. When placing this Hazard, the GM should choose the direction in which the water in the area of the Whirlpool is moving. This is the direction in which targets affected by the Hazard are moved.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Unknown Regions

changes.value: Hazards, Poisons
A creature takes damage from a weapon coated with, or a substance tainted with, Sith Poison.
Every time the target spends a Force Point, until the Sith Poison is neutralized.
Use the Force (DC 25): Every time an attack made by the Sith Poison fails, a character can make a Use the Force check to neutralize the Sith Poison.
Special: If the Sith Poisons' attacks fail 5 consecutive times, it is neutralized automatically.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

See also: Hazards, Poisons

A favorite of The Krath and of The Mecrosa Order, Sith Poison is the most insidious of inventions. Once the toxin is introduced into a Force-user's bloodstream, whether through injection or ingestion, exposed individuals become quicker to anger, and more likely to call on The Dark Side, slowly perverting servants of the Light into agents of the Dark.

Sith Poison Statistics (CL 10)

Keywords: Contact, Ingested, Poison

Trigger: A creature takes damage from a weapon coated with, or a substance tainted with, Sith Poison.

Attack: +12 vs Fortitude Defense (First Time); +12 vs Will Defense (During Recurrence)

Recurrence: Every time the target spends a Force Point, until the Sith Poison is neutralized.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Use the Force (DC 25): Every time an attack made by the Sith Poison fails, a character can make a Use the Force check to neutralize the Sith Poison.

Special: If the Sith Poisons' attacks fail 5 consecutive times, it is neutralized automatically.
system.source: Star Wars Saga Edition Jedi Academy Training Manual

changes.value: Hazards
A creature begins its turn in Zero-Gravity.
Once, after 8 hours within Zero-Gravity.
Treat Injury (DC 20): The character removes the Persistent Condition.
Special: The Persistent Condition from Space Sickness is removed from a creature after 8 hours of rest.

system.description:
See also: Hazards

In Zero-Gravity, some creatures have a hard time maintaining their internal equilibrium.

Space Sickness Statistics (CL 1)

Keywords: Natural

Trigger: A creature begins its turn in Zero-Gravity.

Attack: +0 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: Once, after 8 hours within Zero-Gravity.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Treat Injury (DC 20): The character removes the Persistent Condition.

Special: The Persistent Condition from Space Sickness is removed from a creature after 8 hours of rest.

changes.value: Hazards, Diseases
A creature is damaged by a Rakghoul's Bite attack.
If successful, every five minutes, until the Rakghoul Disease is treated.
Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Rakghoul Disease. Treat Injury (DC 25; Requires Rakghoul Serum): The character treats the Rakghoul Disease.
Special: After three successful attacks, the target transforms into a Rakghoul. For targets other than Medium size, adjust the Rakghoul statistics so that the size matches the target's original size.

system.description:
Reference Book: Star Wars Saga Edition Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide

See also: Hazards, Diseases

When a Rakghoul successfully damages a living creature with its Bite attack, the target may become infected with the Rakghoul Disease.

Rakghoul Disease Statistics (CL 6)

Keywords: Contact, Disease

Trigger: A creature is damaged by a Rakghoul's Bite attack.

Attack: +8 vs Fortitude Defense

Recurrence: If successful, every five minutes, until the Rakghoul Disease is treated.

Suggested Skills: The following are suggested Skills for this Hazard:

  • Knowledge (Life Sciences) (DC 21): The character identifies the Rakghoul Disease.
  • Treat Injury (DC 25; Requires Rakghoul Serum): The character treats the Rakghoul Disease.

Special: After three successful attacks, the target transforms into a Rakghoul. For targets other than Medium size, adjust the Rakghoul statistics so that the size matches the target's original size.
